element.name: Selic
element.documentation:
https://www.rtm.selic.gov.br/portal-selic/
Support for brazilian bonds activities. SELIC is the system which custody is carried out and transactions with most bonds issued by the National Treasury are registered.
The Selic rate, or 'over Selic', is the Brazilian federal funds rate. Precisely, Selic rate is the weighted average interest rate of the overnight interbank operations — collateralized by federal government securities — carried out at the Special System for Settlement and Custody (Selic).
The Selic's platform
The Banco Central do Brasil (BCB) operates and oversees a fundamental financial market infrastructure of the Brazilian Payment System (SPB): the Special System for Settlement and Custody (Selic), which is the central depository for most securities issued by the National Treasury .
The Selic's platform operates modules for the National Treasury’s primary auctions and the secondary market over-the-counter trades. Through a direct connection with the Reserves Transfer System (STR), the Selic's platform provides immediate, simultaneous and final transfer of securities and funds. All operations are settled with their real time gross values, and the funds to be transferred are kept in accounts held at the BCB — the bank reserves or settlement accounts.
Besides the BCB and Treasury, the Selic platform’s participants (authorized settlers) are banks, savings banks, securities brokerage companies and securities distribution companies; other institutions licensed by BCB; mutual funds, pension funds. Other institutional investors may also hold individual accounts at the BCB's discretion. Special services have been developed in Selic platform to meet requirements of clearinghouses, such as special accounts where guarantees are held.
Importantly, the BCB does not interfere in the conditions established by the contracting parties, but it can block, at its exclusive discretion, the access of a participant that is posing risk to the Selic’s operations.

element.name: Line 5.0
element.documentation:
Pre-trade risk management tool (B3).
B3 adopts a pre-trade risk management tool in order to avoid problems in trade execution due to erroneous insertion of trading orders involving very high volumes potentially leading to market disruption (fat finger). LINE is the pre-trade risk management tool provided by B3 and its use is mandatory for full trading participants considered heavy users, since those are the ones representing a greater risk of erroneous insertion of trading orders, considering the algorithms employed. More specifically, according to B3’s Risk Management Manual, the full trading participants whose clients are investors with direct market access (DMA) in modalities DMA Brokers’ Co-location and DMA Investors’ Co-location and/or are classified by B3 as high-frequency investors must necessarily adopt LINE as a pre-trade risk management model.
Said model is based on the review of each order against a set of limits prior to being entered into the order book. If an order implies the violation of one or more limits it is rejected, thus not being included in the order book. The types of limits to which orders are submitted are defined by B3, whereas the values of the limits assigned to each account held by an investor and to each master account are defined by the responsible full trading participant, subject to the maximum
values established by B3. Hence, the analysis is based on the identification of the account to which the trades resulting from the orders will be allocated. B3’s pre-trade risk management tool (LINE) defines for each instrument admitted to trading limits in relation to: • MAXIMUM QUANTITY OR NOTIONAL FOR BUY AND SELL ORDERS PER INSTRUMENT; • LONG AND SHORT POSITION LIMITS PER INSTRUMENT; and • LONG AND SHORT POSITION LIMITS PER EQUIVALENT INSTRUMENT.
By adopting the B3 model, full trading participants are able to define the maximum risk value that fits each investor’s profile, registering in the B3 pre-trade risk management system the value of limits applicable to each account and defined according to the model. The current values for the limits employed by the LINE, the pre-trade risk management tool, for all types of instruments admitted to trading in B3 can be found in
http://www.bmfbovespa.com.br/en_us/services/trading/bm-fbovespapuma-trading-system/formembers-and-traders/tools-for-traders/trade-risk-management-line/.

element.name: Cetip
element.documentation:
nome.cetip.net.br/menu/ctp/TelaPrincipalCetip21
https://www.marketswiki.com/wiki/Cetip
Support for brazilian bonds activities. Cetip delivers registration and depository services for OTC securities. Cetip was launched in 1986 by the Central Bank of Brazil and a group of financial institutions with the aim of promoting more safety and efficiency in the Brazilian private securities market by functioning as an interconnected financial network for private securities and derivatives trading. It is the market's main custodian for corporate fixed income — for which it is currently Latin America's largest custodian — and OTC derivatives.[3]
As Brazil's main share depository, Cetip collects the Brazilian government's tax on Brazilian stocks traded as American depository receipts (ADRs). Brazil introduced the 1.5 percent tax on ADRs in mid-November 2009 to cool off the recent rapid rise in foreign investment capital flowing into Brazilian securities and pushing up the value of the Brazilian real, Dow Jones reported. One month earlier, Brazil's government imposed a 2 percent tax on forex inflows also aimed at dampening down the real.
On June 8, 2011, Cetip and Deutsche Borse's Clearstream announced a deal to launch a collateral management outsourcing service in July 2011. The new Brazilian-based service, allows Cetip customers to handle collateral exposure in their time zone and in real-time. The goal is to help those firms manage their risk across OTC derivatives markets, with an initial focus on collateralization of OTC derivative exposures managed by Cetip. Phase two will focus on assets eligible at Clearstream, thus allowing customers to meet collateral obligations from a larger collateral pool. Cetip and Clearstream began working on the partnership in March 2010, according to a Reuters report.[4]
Cetip recorded $US67 billion in offshore financial derivative contracts held by Brazilian banks in March 2010 as part of increased supervision of such contracts in Brazil. [5]
An important change happened in December of 2010, when Cetip acquired GRV Solutions, a Brazilian company founded in 1995, which is now the company’s Financing Unit. With this acquisition, Cetip doubled in size and made several changes to its management, consolidating its structure to gain speed and efficiency.[6]
Cetip became a publicly-held company with stock listed on Nova Mercado on October 28, 2009.

element.documentation:

The aim of the CPR project is to automate the process of calculating client profitability of the clients of ABN Amro Clearing Bank (AACB). This is accomplished through : • aggregating income from all reporting entities, • automating the calculation of risk-weighted assets (RWA) and • calculation of Return of Equity (ROE) per client.

element.name: APA Euronext
element.documentation:
Approved Publishing Arrangement (APA). MIFID II Post Trade Transparency (PTT, RTS II Derivaties) requires semi direct publications of deals to enable transparent markets. AACB acts as principal and has an reporting obligation. Next to this reporting on behalf is offered. PTT requires that any MiFID II Qualified Investment Firm reports any trade in MiFID II financial instruments, traded on- and off- a trading venue, towards an Approved Publishing Arrangement (APA) in near real time with a limited data set.
Euronext is able to report multiple asset classes. However it is more expensive than CBOE. That is why multiple solution exist .

element.name: Tax Calc Engine
element.documentation:
Tax Basis Cost Reporting ApplicationTax calculation for 1099B clients. (tool replaces Davidson)
Form 1099-B: Proceeds From Broker and Barter Exchange is a federal tax form that itemizes a taxpayer's gains or losses in every transaction made over the course of a tax year. The broker or barter exchange must mail a copy of the form to all clients by January 31st of the year following the tax year.
Taxpayers transfer the information from Form 1099-B to Form 8949 to calculate their preliminary gains and losses. The result is entered onto Schedule D of the tax return.

element.name: MCR tool
element.documentation:
MCR identifies an unique customer in multiple systems and merges all of them together leading to a Global ID which is an unique reference for the same business customer in multiple systems. This record is used in several reporting chains.
Master Customer Reference (MCR) is an initiative of AAB that, amongst other, aims to improve regulatory reporting (i.e. Large Exposures) and risk control by uniquely identifying clients of ABNAMRO Bank or any of its branches and subs. This includes all clients of AACB. A secure interface is set up between the externally hosted Salesforce application and AAC IT Infra, and (b) local client IDs in Salesforce are reconciled with the local client IDs in CLP (as used in the monthly financial/risk reports)
The MCR matches CLP client data with Salesforce client data. It shows the number of matched clients per import set and generates a GXI output file listing consolidated client data.

element.name: Blue Cross Blue Shield
element.documentation:
An electronic blue sheet is an electronic request for detailed information about trades sent to clearing firms, broker dealers and market makers by the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC). Electronic blue sheets include the name of the security, its price, the date of the transaction, the size of the transaction and the parties involved. This information request was historically mailed to clearing firms on blue forms. As the daily volume of securities increased, this process has moved to an electronic system in order to facilitate collection.
BREAKING DOWN Electronic Blue Sheet (EBS)
Collection of this information is undertaken in order to give the SEC a better understanding of developing trading strategies by institutions and professional traders. The SEC also uses the information to determine if securities laws are being broken especially those related to insider trading. The information is also used to examine the causes of extreme security volatility with the SEC reconstructing the transactions over a period time.
The information gathered from all types of blue sheets is used by FINRA’s Office of Fraud Detection and Market Intelligence to find and identify irregularities in trading activity. The irregularities could be instances of insider trading or other illegal actions.
The base form of the blue sheet gives the SEC detailed information about trades performed by a firm and its clients. The information includes the security's name, the date traded, price, transaction size and a list of the parties involved. The information from a blue sheet may be used to assess why a security experienced elevated degrees of volatility.
Details Electronic Blue Sheets Provide to Regulators
Blue sheets are expected to include information about the account holder and trades. Whether in digital form or on paper the intent of the document is to give the SEC and other regulators a way to process and understand the flow of trading activity. Incomplete or inaccurate information may impede regulators who are searching for cases of fraud or insider trading.
Firms can face fines if it is discovered that they supplied regulators with insufficient or erroneous blue sheet information. For example, Citigroup agreed to pay a $7-million fine in 2016 after the SEC found the firm had provided incomplete blue sheet data for 15 Years. Citigroup agreed to pay the penalty and admit wrongdoing to settle the charges. The SEC said that a computer coding error caused the firm to provide regulators with incomplete blue sheet information regarding the trades it executed.
The error occurred with software Citigroup used when it processed requests for its blue sheet data. This led to the omission of 26,810 transactions when Citigroup responded to blue sheet requests between 1999 and 2014.

element.name: Dataiku
element.documentation:
https://www.dataiku.com/
Dataiku DSS is the collaborative data science software platform for teams of data scientists, data analysts, and engineers to explore, prototype, build, and deliver their own data products more efficiently.
Use notebooks (Python, R, Spark, Scala, Hive, etc.) or a customizable drag-and-drop visual interface at any step of the predictive dataflow prototyping process – from wrangling to analysis to modeling.
Profile the data visually at every step of the analysis. Interactively explore and chart your data using 25+ built-in charts. Prepare, enrich, blend, and clean data using 80+ built-in functions.
Leverage Machine Learning technologies (Scikit-Learn, MLlib, TensorFlow, Keras, etc.) in a visual UI. Build & optimize models in Python or R and integrate any external ML library through code APIs (SageMaker, Google Cloud AI, ACS, etc.) Get instant visual & statistical feedback on model performance.
Bundle your whole workflow as a single deployable package for real-time predictions with our REST API Monitor your live data in-production with dashboard and data validation policies (e.g., model metrics, drift, data consistency, etc.) If something’s off, get notified and easily roll back to a previous version.

element.name: TriParty BNY
element.documentation:
Tri-party is a collateral management solution. In a Tri-party trade a Tri-party agent will take care of the collateral management. Tri-party enables AAC to do trades with a wider array of counterparties compared to bilaterally collateralized trades. BNY Mellon's Collateral management portal. Potential losses are mainly based on:
- BNYM system down. Allocation algorithm not run. AAC can't recall shares in time.
- Wrong pricing info provided by BNYM. Could lead to over-collateralization, but
expected losses should be <500k.
- Misrepresentation of inventory (e.g. for tax purposes)
- Misrepresentation of allocated vs unallocated inventory in safekeeping account
- Event of default counterparty and/or BNYM
Transactions from one safekeeping account to another and Tri-party trades against counterparties are concerned, no client transactions. Data subject to reporting requirements (DNB) but not adjusted/entered in Tri-party solution.

element.name: Taskize Connect
element.documentation:
03-2022 request for approval tp ARB
Taskize Connect is a 3rd party internet based application (All managed by vendor), which is used by Euroclear for the appeal and management of client queries relating to the Central Securities Depository Regulation and related Settlement Discipline Regime. Taskize is Euroclear’s preferred method of communication for clients to contact client services for their operational queries. It replaces phone and email for the management of queries and sharing of client trade and settlement information.
Clients are required to submit their appeal in writing email to AACB Client Service Management before the 8th business day of the following month. AACB must submit client appeals to the relevant CSD no later than the 10th business day of the following month. Therefore, access to Taskize must be maintained leading up to and covering these dates to facilitate Euroclear penalty appeals and mitigate related liabilities.

element.name: RegSho
element.documentation:
RegSho – this is a regulatory implementation that governs our short sale process. Very complex business logic that is difficult to support and could present a significant problem for us over time.
Short selling
Prohibition: There is no general ban or restriction on short-selling but anti-market manipulation and anti-fraud rules apply to short-selling of listed securities on US exchanges. There is a ban on certain “insiders” of US public companies from effecting naked short sales or sales “against the box”. Rule 105 of Regulation M prohibits purchasing securities in follow-on and secondary offerings when the purchaser has effected short sales in the securities within a certain amount of time prior to the pricing of an offering.
Disclosure There is no individual disclosure obligation in respect of either naked or covered short-selling. FINRA Rule 4560 requires members to maintain a record of gross short positions in all customers and proprietary firm accounts in all equity securities and report the information to FINRA.

element.name: OMGEO
element.documentation:
Owned by DTCC.
Fully integrated straight-through-processing (STP) solution for institutional post-trade processing, linking an electronic allocation engine, a central matching solution and the leading account and standing settlement instruction (SSI) database.
About OmgeoSM
Formed in 2001, Omgeo automates trade lifecycle events between investment managers, broker/dealers and custodian banks, enabling 6,500 clients and 80 technology partners in 52 countries around the world to seamlessly connect and interoperate. By automating and streamlining post-trade operations, Omgeo enables clients to accelerate the clearing and settlement of trades, and better manage and reduce their counterparty and credit risk. Omgeo’s strength lies within its global community and its ability to create solutions to enable clients to realize clear returns on their investment strategies, while responding to changing market and regulatory conditions. Across borders, asset classes, and trade lifecycles, Omgeo is the global standard for operational efficiency across the investment industry. For more information, please visit www.omgeo.com.

View the state of the connection
Handle errors

The Equiduct GUI si a pre-tade risk GUI for the pre-trade risk department only. The pre-trade risk department can set trading limits and execute the kill switch when necessary.
The GUI displays information from AACB's clients with regard to orders and limit usage
It is a web based GUI to set and monitor pre-trade risk controls and to active the kill switch when needed. The web based GUI is used to control the risk on Equiduct, which is a new market cleared via EuroCCP and LCH SA

element.name: MAGMA GUI
element.documentation: The GUI will be used to view trading limits and to execute the kill switch. Trading limits can be viewed in order to see how much margin the client has used in comparison to its total usable margin that is allowed by pre -trade risk. (pre-trade limits). Those trading limits can be adjusted by calling Yapi Kredi and they will adjust the trading limits on behalf of AACB. Turkish regulations do not allow AACB to set the limits themselves. The kill switch functionality, on the other hand, can be used by AACB. By pushing this buttion, AACB can stop all trading of the client on Borsa Istanbul.

element.name: Siscoserv (BR)
element.documentation:
System to attend Brazilian SISCOSERV requirements. The Federal Revenue of Brazil (RFB) of the Ministry of Economy (ME) and the Special Secretariats of Foreign Trade and International Affairs (Secint), published on 21 October 2020 in the Official Gazette the Joint Ordinance SECINT / RFB nº 22.091, which formalizes the definitive shutdown of Siscoserv.
Siscoserv is an integrated information system of the Ministry of Development, and consists of the obligation to record information related to transactions carried out between residents or domiciled in Brazil and residents or domiciled abroad that comprise services, intangibles and other operations that produce variations in equity individuals, legal entities or depersonalized entities.
The measure materializes the decision announced on 17 August of this year by the Ministry of Economy and is part of a process of reducing bureaucracy and improving the business environment promoted by the Federal Government, driven by the principles contained in article 2, of Law No. 13,874 / 2019 (Law Economic Freedom).
Therefore, the Ordinance that dealt with the mandatory registration with SISCOSERV was revoked, and with the termination of the obligation, Brazilian importers and exporters no longer need to register such information in the system.

element.name: Energy, Metal & Commodities
element.documentation:
ABN AMRO Clearing ranks amongst the leading providers of clearing services on energy, metals and commodities exchanges. We offer our clients a one-stop shop service with high level solutions for financing, specialized clearing and execution services. Next to specialized execution desks in Chicago, New York and London we also run an 'Overnight execution desk' for derivatives contracts globally. Our experience with physical delivery of commodity contracts is broadly recognized and appreciated. We facilitate the full value chain through efficient collaboration with other ABN AMRO business units. This includes origination and hedging through centrally cleared contracts and smart inventory solutions up to the production of finished goods.
ABN AMRO Clearing provides 4 product groups
Energy
Metals
Soft Commodities
Agricultural Commodities

element.name: BaaS
element.documentation:
ABN AMRO Clearing’s: Banking as a Service
Banking as a Service (BaaS) enables financial services companies to hold client cash amounts for and on behalf of their respective clients, by use of individual client bank accounts held in the books of ABN AMRO Clearing Bank N.V. (AACB). BaaS provides an alternative solution for the use of investment vehicles, such as fiduciary trustees and/or money market funds, whereby it aims to increase capital efficiency, minimise the administrative burden and simultaneously mitigates the exposure on underlying investment risks.
Banking as a Service offers to hold client money deposits under the Dutch deposit guarantee system, governed by a sound regulatory and legal framework. While your clients will have their respective cash accounts held in the books of AACB, you will remain the “owner” of the client relationship. Your clients will manage and monitor their respective cash account through your website and related tools and/or apps.
It's developed on a new distributed ledger platform, named “Panopticon”, based on Hyperledger fabric and is scaled to process up to 500 transactions per second. Using the available interfaces, the AACB banking service can be integrated in your systems to allow an optimal client experience.
The Deposit Guarantee Scheme at ABN AMRO Clearing Bank
ABN AMRO Clearing Bank (AACB) holds a banking licence issued by the Dutch central bank. Under the terms of the Financial Supervision Act, you are entitled to make a claim for compensation under the Deposit Guarantee Scheme if AACB is unable to meet its financial obligations. The scheme covers your deposits with AACB up to a certain maximum value.
You are eligible for compensation under the Deposit Guarantee Scheme if:
your bank is a member of the Deposit Guarantee Scheme; and
the product in question is covered by the Deposit Guarantee Scheme; and
you are an account-holder who is eligible for compensation under the Deposit Guarantee Scheme.
Information on the Deposit Guarantee Scheme:
See the fact sheet​ (PDF 55 KB) for information on the most important aspects of the Deposit Guarantee Scheme. The fact sheet also includes information on businesses and products that are not covered by the scheme. The bank will send you a copy of the fact sheet (or will let you know how you can access it) once a year. The same information is also included with your statements of account (if you receive these).
See the information on the Deposit Guarantee Scheme on the website of the Dutch central bank

element.name: Energy
element.documentation:
ABN AMRO Clearing ranks amongst the leading providers of clearing services on Energy & Commodity Exchanges around the globe. With more than 20 years’ intensive involvement in the global energy sector, we have strongly developed our service offering through market coverage, dedicated risk monitoring and operational organization with a dedicated focus on this complex industry.
Due to the unique business model built around clearing, ABN AMRO Clearing is committed to clearing expansion, development and innovation that serve the benefit of its clients and the Energy Industry.
We have experienced teams servicing clients out of our offices Amsterdam, Chicago, Frankfurt, London and New York.
Tailored solutions
We focus on tailored solutions and offer services to clients in all areas of the energy value chain.
Execution
Clearing
Settlement
Market Commentary
Risk/Trade/Margin financing
Physical delivery services
We also provide clients with Direct Market Access to the physical/Financial markets in Energy & Commodity Products.

element.name: Risk Management
element.documentation:
Our service offering
Our clients profit from our proven proprietary risk management model that calculates risk offsets across markets and products. By close and real-time risk monitoring we aim to ensure to protect our firm and therefore also our clients’ assets. We have developed our risk management system over the last 20 years, in close collaboration with our clients. We continually assess its functioning and look to improve on its correlation accuracy. Market and credit risk are key building blocks of our clearing Risk Model.
Correlation haircut
Our in-house built Correlation haircut model optimizes capital requirements for our clients and has been developed to provide coverage of all asset classes.The Correlation haircut takes into account correlations between different equities, indices, bonds and derivative products across asset classes when calculating the haircut, offering substantial added value by offsetting correlated products on various exchanges.The application of our Correlation Haircut Risk model can lead to significant savings in terms of capital requirements.
Risk Management
We optimise your capital utilisation by providing correlation offset between margin requirements linked to multiple market memberships and asset classes. Our risk management department monitors all client positions in real time. Our risk management teams include professionals with trading experience. They have daily client interaction and show deep understanding of the market and of our clients’ strategies and trading behaviour.
Our Risk model is most appropriate to generate capital efficiencies for strategies like:
- Relative value
- Volatility arbitrage
- Long/Short equity strategies
- Quantitative strategies.
These specific services are open to all professional and ECP clients and are mostly used by principal trading groups, corporate hedgers and prime brokerage clients.

element.name: Securities Financing
element.documentation: Providing leverage.

element.name: Derivatives Clearing
element.documentation:
ABN AMRO Clearing offers clearing services on the world's leading derivatives markets. We hold top 3 positions, based on market share of transactions cleared. Our processing capacity is aimed at efficiently dealing STP with high transaction volumes, as illustrated by an average of 20 million transactions that flow through our systems globally on a daily basis.
Listed Derivatives
Contract Coverage
We cover major markets in US and Europe for the following contracts:
- Equities and Equity index
- Fixed Income and short term interest rate instruments
- Agricultural products (grain, soy, wheat, …)
- Metals (base materials, precious metals, …)
- Soft commodities (cocoa, coffee)
- Oil and gas
- Electricity
Product offering
We offer global clearing services on a complete suite of derivatives products:
- Options
- Futures
- Warrants
- Energy Commodities
- Soft and Agricultural Commodities
- Metals
- Power
OTC Derivatives
ABN AMRO Clearing offers OTC Derivatives Clearing Services for Financial Institutions, Institutional Investors, Brokers and Market Makers. We service our clients as a one-stop-shop by offering:
- Trade Execution (by providing access to liquidity pools such as Bloomberg and Tradeweb.)
- CCP Clearing (by supporting multiple account structures offered by the CCP's. We clear LCH Clearing, Eurex and Eurex ISA Direct.)
- Collateral Management (a full suite, including pre-funding and intra-day and overnight margin calls to minimize daily operational burden and reduce our clients' cash liquidity constraints.)
- Regulatory Reporting (all cleared trades are reported to a Trade Repository.)
We provide OTC Clearing Derivatives for the following products*:
- Interest Rate Swaps (Plain Vanilla/Basis Swaps)
- Overnight Index Swaps (OIS)
- Variable Notional Swaps (VNS) / Amortizing Swaps
*Supported currencies EUR, USD, GBP, CHF and YEN

element.name: Global Execution Services (GES)
element.documentation:
We can provide execution services and access to every major derivative, equity and commodity exchange in the world. Our ethos is to provide technical solutions to our clients to empower them to be up and running on markets quickly, efficiently, and cost effectively. Our wide array of services suits high-end algorithmic traders, brokers, proprietary traders etc.
Our offer includes vendor solutions and global FIX connectivity. You can access our global network with a single connection to a node nearest to your office.
Specialised services
These specific services are open to all professional and ECP clients and are mostly used by principal trading groups, corporate hedgers and prime brokerage clients.

element.name: Bridge Financing
element.documentation: Bridge funding, also known as bridge financing, is a form of temporary, intermediate funding intended to cover a business's short-term expenses until long-term funding is secured. If a business owner needs money fast so that he or she can continue their business's operations, a bridge loan may be a viable option.

element.name: Securities Clearing
element.documentation:
Our service offering
ABN AMRO Clearing is an active General Clearing Member on the most relevant securities exchanges and platforms around the globe. Our aim is always to connect as close as possible to the market infrastructure. This allows our clients to benefit from a first-hand connection to the street, enabling cut off times for our clients close to market deadlines and presenting them with a most competitive pricing.
Tailored solutions
Our securities clearing offering allows us to offer integrated Securities and Derivatives clearing services to clients. This allows operational efficiencies, economies of scale and risk offset between instruments in arbitrage strategies. We service clients for Equities, Fixed Income, Warrants, ETFs, ADRs.
Our leading position in Equity strategies allows clients to benefit from our large inventory of securities to improve settlement efficiency and to cover short positions.
This specific service is open to all professional and ECP clients and is mostly used by principal trading groups and prime brokerage clients.
Specialized services
We have specialist settlement teams to facilitate the handling of creation/redemption instructions for ETFs and conversions for ADR/ordinary shares.
ABN AMRO Clearing acts as custodian and settlement agent for its clients. We are fully interfaced with Securities Settlement Systems and CSDs, and manage a large network of sub-custodians. Managing the complete value chain from Execution, Clearing to settlement allows higher efficiency and costs containment. We fully comply with Swift market standards.
Combining OTC contracts in a single sheet with listed derivatives and underlying assets will lead to capital efficiencies and collateral optimization in combination with lower risk and credit exposure.
These specific services are open to all professional and ECP clients and are mostly used by principal trading groups and prime brokerage clients.

element.name: OTC Clearing Derivatives
element.documentation:
We provide OTC Clearing Derivatives for the following products*:
- Interest Rate Swaps (Plain Vanilla/Basis Swaps)
- Overnight Index Swaps (OIS)
- Variable Notional Swaps (VNS) / Amortizing Swaps
*Supported currencies EUR, USD, GBP, CHF and YEN

element.name: Financing
element.documentation:
Our service offering
ABN AMRO Clearing offers clients optimised capital utilisation by providing correlation offset based on a portfolio approach of your overall risk position in our books. We can provide leverage based on the overall net liquidity position and depending on trading strategies deployed. For short positions our clients gain access to a deep pool of liquidity for securities borrowing.
Our banking network gives access to a full range of treasury and banking services, including asset financing and securities lending.
Specialized services
We have specialist settlement teams to facilitate the handling of creation/redemption instructions for ETFs and conversions for ADR/ordinary shares.
ABN AMRO Clearing acts as custodian and settlement agent for its clients. We are fully interfaced with Securities Settlement Systems and CSDs, and manage a large network of sub-custodians. Managing the complete value chain from Execution, Clearing to settlement allows higher efficiency and costs containment. We fully comply with Swift market standards.
Combining OTC contracts in a single sheet with listed derivatives and underlying assets will lead to capital efficiencies and collateral optimization in combination with lower risk and credit exposure.
These specific services are open to all professional and ECP clients and are mostly used by principal trading groups and prime brokerage clients.
Read more about our clients
Financing
We closely cooperate with Trade & Commodity Finance, another business line of ABN AMRO Bank. This results in efficient inventory financing solutions in combination with on-exchange hedging of the price risk.
We offer a complete set of financing services ranging from Margin Financing, Cash Financing, Securities Financing to leverage and Bridge Financing.
These specific services are open to all professional and ECP clients and are mostly used by principal trading groups, corporate hedgers and prime brokerage clients

element.name: OTC Derivatives
element.documentation:
OTC Derivatives
ABN AMRO Clearing offers OTC Derivatives Clearing Services for Financial Institutions, Institutional Investors, Brokers and Market Makers. We service our clients as a one-stop-shop by offering:
- Trade Execution (by providing access to liquidity pools such as Bloomberg and Tradeweb.)
- CCP Clearing (by supporting multiple account structures offered by the CCP's. We clear LCH Clearing, Eurex and Eurex ISA Direct.)
- Collateral Management (a full suite, including pre-funding and intra-day and overnight margin calls to minimize daily operational burden and reduce our clients' cash liquidity constraints.)
- Regulatory Reporting (all cleared trades are reported to a Trade Repository.)

element.name: Corporate Actions
element.documentation:
We can optimize your cash management and investment portfolio by crediting payments into the account on the contractual payment date, in the currency of preference.
Corporate actions, income collection and information flows are processed automatically. Reporting and instructing flows through our web-based tool, and instructions are straight-through uploaded into our system for execution.
Specialized services
Through our direct access to most relevant CSDs we allow instruction deadlines close to the market cut off time.
Our integrated custody service allows our clients to receive timely and accurate Corporate Action information and allows sharp cut-off times for instructing close to market deadlines.. Using SWIFT communication for reporting and instructing corporate actions, we ensure the highest level of STP processing with the markets and our clients.
These specific services are open to all professional and ECP clients and are mostly used by principal trading groups and prime brokerage clients.

element.name: FX clearing
element.documentation:
Our service offering
Our clients enjoy access to a variety of FX liquidity venues, both Electronic Currency Networks (ECN) and Single Bank Platforms from partner banks.
ABN AMRO Clearing acts as principal on its clients behalf and extends the credit held with multiple counterparties to them (under ISDA, Master Confirmation Agreement and Credit Support Annex) to support their Speculative, Hedging or Treasury requirements.
Specialized services
ABN AMRO Clearing includes these OTC FX positions within a cross-product portfolio. This generates maximum offset in our correlation margining risk tool between all OTC and exchanged-traded securities, futures, and derivatives.
We operate an FX specific middle office system to create greater efficiencies for our algorithmic client base.
Our FX service complements our complete suite of Prime services. Our FX solutions are used for both arbitrage and hedging purposes. We thus effectively support multi-strategy funds conducting pure FX or relative value arbitrage strategies.

element.name: Custody
element.documentation:
Custody services are an essential part of our DNA. At ABN AMRO Clearing we understand the importance of asset protection, and can offer asset segregation at a granular level. Depending on the requirements and expectations from our clients, we will implement the best fitting solution.
Specialized services
ABN AMRO Clearing acts as custodian for its clients and fully comply with Swift market standards. Our deep expertise in custody and asset protection mechanism allow clients to comply with funds regulations (UCITS, AIFMD) while benefiting from an award winning level of service.
Clients can select to be part of the omnibus account. This allows them to benefit from the pool approach to enhance settlement efficiency, as documented in the clearing contract.
These specific services are open to all professional and ECP clients and are mostly used by principal trading groups and prime brokerage clients.

element.name: Execution, Clearing & Settlement
element.documentation:
Our broker services cover electronic execution on selected markets combined with our dedicated custody services. Transactions are booked automatically into segregated settlement & custody accounts. Clients benefit from a full STP clearing to settlement process, combined with recognised sub-custodian services.
Specialized services
On-line brokers can benefit from our integrated execution, clearing & settlement solution to combine a wide execution capacity with reduced settlement complexity and optimized costs.
Our Prime broker service offers efficiencies to asset managers and hedge funds that want to reduce complexity of their back office operations.
These specific services are open to all professional and ECP clients and are mostly used by principal trading groups and prime brokerage clients.

element.name: Soft Commodities
element.documentation:
Our service offering
Our London based team has long-standing experience in the domain of soft commodities.
Tailored solutions
Our specialized Soft Commodity execution desk in London covers the whole spectrum of softs products across the principal international Exchanges. Combining many years of experience, the team are well versed in the key fundamental market drivers as well as in analysing technical developments. Our client base is taken from the full range of market participants including major end-users, trade houses, exporters and funds.
This specific service is open to all professional and ECP clients and is mostly used by corporate hedgers and prime brokerage clients.

element.name: Asset services
element.documentation:
Our full custody service in Europe provides direct connections to the local CSDs in Belgium, the Netherlands, France, Germany, United Kingdom, Switzerland and internationally into Clearstream. All connections are managed from our operations platform in Amsterdam, enabling us to provide custody services for these markets from one central platform, under a single legal contract. Our global custody services are based on a network of selected local custodians covering 50 markets, alongside our direct connections to most of the local CSDs relevant to our business.
Custody services in the US and Asia-Pacific are performed from our clearing platform, as mostly related to on-exchange transactions. Similar to the set up in Europe, our regional operations teams have access to the local CSD to enhance processing efficiency.

element.name: Agri Cultural commodities
element.documentation:
Our service offering
Our Chicago based team has a great reputation in the domain of agricultural commodities.
Tailored solutions
Our Chicago based agricultural team offers a complete commodity brokerage experience with market commentary, outlook, and analysis to assist agricultural clients in making sound marketing decisions. Our team has over 30 years of experience in trading futures and options on major agricultural commodity exchanges. Our "boots on the ground" experience is coupled with fundamental and technical research and analysis of cash and futures markets. This make us a logical choice to meet all your brokerage needs, right from the midst of the heartland, USA.
This specific service is open to all clients. It is mostly used by corporate hedgers.

element.name: Metals
element.documentation:
Our service offering
With access to LME & COMEX we cover the most important reference markets for price formation in metal contracts.
Tailored solutions
Our specialized Metals execution desk in New York and London provides 24HR trading coverage, experienced metals professionals to execute your hedging strategies, back office (margins and deliveries) support, and fundamental and technical information reports sent daily. We also set up, monitor and assist customers with trade systems and facilitate access to some of the most professional systems.
This specific service is open to all professional and ECP clients and is mostly used by corporate hedgers.

element.name: Settlement
element.documentation:
Our service offering
Efficiency and high STP rates are critical in the settlement domain. Having automated processing in place leads to low fail rates, relying on in-house developed automated repair tools for enhanced STP processing.
Electronic instructing tools and intraday reports enable our clients to follow the entire process in real-time : confirmation or pre-matching, matching and settlement.
Direct access to local CSD's allows sharp cut-off times for instructing settlements close to market deadlines.
Specialized services
We have specialist settlement teams to facilitate the handling of creation/redemption instructions for ETFs and conversions for ADR/ordinary shares.
ABN AMRO Clearing acts as custodian and settlement agent for its clients. We are fully interfaced with Securities Settlement Systems and CSDs, and manage a large network of sub-custodians. Managing the complete value chain from Execution, Clearing to settlement allows higher efficiency and costs containment. We fully comply with Swift market standards.
Combining OTC contracts in a single sheet with listed derivatives and underlying assets will lead to capital efficiencies and collateral optimization in combination with lower risk and credit exposure.
These specific services are open to all professional and ECP clients and are mostly used by principal trading groups and prime brokerage clients.

element.name: Banking as a Service (BaaS)
element.documentation:
Using distributed legder technology AACB, as a regulated bank, will offer non-banks banking facilities for their clients so these retail clients can open dedicated cash accounts with AACB to trade financial products with the non-bank. The non bank must be able to perform the required KYC checks.
The account opened for retail clients are dedicated account for one purpose only. As such they do not fall under PSD2.

element.documentation: Offer clients the opportunity to make use of their voting rights. Register clients whish to act on shareholders meeting using proxy taking country law into consideration Spot shareholder (anual) meetings for eleginle shareholders based on position details and vendor information Distribute prior to a meeting elegible shareholders may receive voting and proxty information If client whishes to execise his rights via proxy collect their opinions Distribute/execute his voice on the meeting Collect meeting notes inclusive vote outcome Distribute meeting notes

element.name: 07:1:1 Register & set up Proxy client & preferences
06:0 Position management
element.documentation:
Position calculation can be done on historical or on stored validated positions. These validated postions are events and stored as event. Some can change due to missing information like money balances or reord day positions.
-MICS shows Borrow positions as settled short. This is not reflecting the real situation. Settled short does not exist. Position can only be long or borrowed. A client can sell short without having the underlying securities. Transaction than either be filled by borrowing or stays unsetlled overdue.
- Cash can be stored in the external world on multiple external cash accounts in various timezones having multiple interest conditions. To express this a money "depot" should be added over which various interest conditions can be set. No overall netting as present.

element.name: 06:6:0 Determine safe custody/tangibles position
element.documentation: Process calculates the Securities postions for passing on / chargin custody fees

element.name: 06:2:0 Calculate Positions
element.documentation: Calculated Fianancial Instrument postion. Calculations done on various postion levels.

element.name: 06:2:1 Calculate defined position events
element.documentation: EOD, ENM, EOY, taxable postion, record day position, ex-day position, End of processing day position, End of market position, unsettled position, settled position, end of calendar day position (inclusive corrections mad later)

element.name: 06:7:0 Manage physical securities
element.documentation: In exceptions we sometimes still receive physical securities which must be dealt with in a safe and secure way.

element.name: 06:3:0 Align Position
element.documentation:
Handles
-Position reservation request and releases.
-EOD Open Close errors based on check with CCP's
-US Seggregated account set up to comply with SEC 15-3-3

element.name: 06:3:1:0 Regulate stock
element.documentation:
two processes
-If we receive a dump (FOP) on a depot account for which we do not have a matching instruction we must act within 24 hours.
-US: positions must be held on the right account type. If we notice a position to be on the false account we must book it over to the right one (f.i. seggregate to non seggregated account)

element.name: 06:3:2:0 Block/Release Derivatives postion
element.documentation:
Certain processes will block a derivatives position during their execution so no other processes can use the blocked postion. Blocking can be done on total or partial part of the position.
Processes that can block a position are:
-Exercise
-Tender/Assignment
-Give up
-Corporate events
If a position is blocked new position events are not longer processes and temporary stored. A process will check in regulary intervals if the position is released againg after which the event will be processes in position managment process.

element.name: 06:4:0 Valuate Trades/Position
element.documentation: Calculate position valuation(s).

element.name: 06:3:3:4 Retrieve all closing prices for avarage priced futures
06:1:0 Administrate outstanding events
element.documentation:
Register all relevant position events (an postion invent is an event which influence a position)
Attribute Fields differ per financial instrument class. Down stream processes/service could have need of various field information to do its processing. Choice to enrich record direct or retrive information which is deductable of of reference data tables.
Position is an dynamic element in time. Certain positions like end of processing day or valuated position at day x must always be known. Also brakdown to the underlying transactions. More ways to do this. Netted position eod for balancing instrument could be an event to store as well. Calculations could be build upon these EOD and new intraday events

element.name: 06:1:6:2:0 Update & registrar credit line and usages
06:1:6:2:1 Update & registrar AAC credit line and usages
06:1:6:2:2 Update & registrar available client credit line
Create / Update position for what if scenario planning
06:1:3 Handle resent event request
element.documentation: Technical, process defined to be aware of this behaviour. Supports also BCP measures.

element.name: 06:1:1:0 Registrar standardised events
element.documentation: In MICS NG we have a check for derivatives to see if option is not blocked by processing of a corporate action. In MICS NG the CA event must first be processed on the existing postion/outstanding events. Needed in the new situation?

element.name: 06:1:1:5 Check correctness open/close data
element.documentation: Applicable for options traded by certain market parties

element.name: 06:1:1:3 log fee amount and status fee process
06:1:1:4 log position service distribution
element.documentation: willen we dit als business proces? Weten welke service heeft geconsumeerd? Voor audit trail van belang, zit dan in monito laag)

element.name: 06:5:5 Calculate P&L
element.documentation: Client service to Calculate client P&L. Calculations on various postional levels.

element.name: 06:5:3 Calculate value using Offset prices
element.documentation:
Offset price calculation shows the client P&L. We have a default we use to generate an overview for ourselve (risk). Next it is also a client service to determine the clients P&L based on his own bookkeeping method.
Client can choose out of a limited set of methods to use. Calculation based on the choosen accounting method (LIFO, FIFO, own close out, ...) also taking the bookyear into consideration.

element.name: 06:5:2 Calculate value based on theoretical price
06:5:4 Calculated value collateral using haircut prices counterparty
06:5:1 Calculate value based on market prices

23:0 Reconcile
element.documentation: Provide for comparison and alignment of client and street side administrations in order to uncover any possible discrepancies. This is done by balancing positions between the depository accounts within BCC-internal depository administration and BCC securities accounts with the depository bank.

element.name: 23:4:1:1 Direct Assignment of breaks to departments
23:4:1:3 Inform and allocate break to responsible department
23:4:3:3 Order booking of break to suspence account
23:4:3:1 Select unsolved breaks older than 2 days
23:4:4:0 Determine if unsolved differences must be booked to suspence account
23:3:0 Match or compare (source) data
element.documentation:
Ik heb hier hypothese genomen dat de te reconcilieren data batch gewijs wordt ingelezen. Na herstel is het bij de volgende inlees actie/reconciliatie te constateren. Het proces reconcile source data vergelijkt ook historische breaks met de nieuwe situatie om te zien of situatie nog bestaat. De link zit over/in het gebruik maken van de databuffer outstanding breaks. Het resultaat van een break vergelijking wordt weer aan proces solve differences aangeboden.
Zou natuurlijk ook anders gemodelleerd kunnen worden.

element.name: 23:6:1 Check if reported break still exist
23:6:2 Update break status incl risks run
23:5:5 Collect status from all breaks off the Priority report
23:2 Translate/ enrich Data to reconcile (add recon type)
23:8:6 Set recon type action rules
element.documentation: Per recon the actions to follow must be listed as they can differ.

element.name: 05:0 Settle financial instruments
element.documentation: Act to get securities delivered and received between settlement parties and to assure that rights attached to the securities at trade date (e.g. dividend) are settled as well.

element.name: 05:6 Settle Instruction
element.documentation: Our street side partner will inform us if the settlement has occured. We use this trigger to perform the internal settlement (allocate external trigger to internal instruction). In some cases it is possible that we receive a partial settlement. In this case part of the instruction stays open to be settled at a later moment in time. The obligatory postings from process 03.2 will be reversed and the "real"psotings will be made.

element.name: 05:6:0 Reverse instruction by Custodian
element.documentation: Possibility exists that custodians informs us after settlement that settlement actually did not take place. The settlement must be reveresed to an unsettled status. In this case the settlement fees will not be returned to our client.

element.name: 05:8 Registar client settlement agreements
element.documentation: This process register client specific business rules to steer the settlement process tailored to clients needs.

element.name: 05:9 ETF creation/redemption
element.documentation: Via these processes AACB offers client the service to create or redeem an Exchange Traded Fund using AACB as executing broker for this process.

element.name: 05:9:1:0 ETF component process
element.documentation: Register ETF details and composition

element.name: 05:9:2:0 Preliminary ETF settlement process
element.documentation: Prepare settlement process for an ETF conversion/ creation

element.name: 05:9:1:2:2 Perform treasury check
element.documentation: Check funding

element.name: 05:9:1:2:4 Approve upper limits
element.documentation:
Underlimit validation is a automated function.
Upper limit confirmation is a automated & manual function.

element.name: 05:9:1:1:0 Receive creation redemption request
element.documentation: Recieve and validate client creation redemtption request

element.name: 05:9:1:5:0 Process rejected ETF requests
element.documentation: Handle bounced orders by issuer

element.name: 05:9:1:3:0 Send order to market/issuer
element.documentation: Sent order ETF issuer

element.name: 05:9:1:2:3 Perform SBL check
element.documentation: Check, when needed if ULV can be lended.

element.name: 05:9:1:2:5 Time stamp & log approved order
element.documentation: Log time after finishing proces steps and log order and status

element.name: 05:9:1:4:1 Aggregate order with same instrument & action
05:9:2:2 Calculate Preliminary settlement price ETF order
05:9:1:2:1 Perform risk check
element.documentation: Check if order is within risk limits set

element.name: 05:9:1:2:0 Check order execution elegibility
element.documentation: Check/validate order details and data validity

element.name: 05:9:4:0 Create and book final ETF postings
05:9:1:4:0 Create ETF order
element.documentation: If order is accepted create order

element.name: 05:9:1:1:3 Process client order cancel request
element.documentation: Check if order can cancelled and cancel order or inform client he is to late to cancel

element.name: 05:9:1:3:1 Confirm & handle new hights aggregated orders
element.documentation: automated & manual function

element.name: 05:9:1:1:1 Validate sender & senders mandate
element.documentation: If instruction is not received via CII validation and authorisation must be done.

element.name: 05:9:1:1:2 Classify order type
element.documentation: Identify instruction type to steer downstream processing

element.name: 05:9:1:1:4 Time stamp & log pending order
element.documentation: Orders, instruction will get a time stamp when received, raw order data will be logged.

element.name: 05:3 External instructing
element.documentation: When an instruction is accepted and external notification must take place our custodian will be instructed.

element.name: 05:3:0 Instruct Settlement
element.documentation: This process deals with the street side instructing of the settlement process.

element.name: 05:4 Pre settlement processing
element.documentation:
In the pre-settlement process the organisation must be made ready and keep a close watch. This means:
- Treasury must be informed to arrange funding and transfer money to the right nostro account when needed
- B&L must be informed if client went short a securities must be lended or reserved for delivering
- Operations must follow the settlement, if overdue a close monitoring is needed and action must be taken when necessary.

element.name: 05:4:5:0 Monitor settlement progress
element.documentation: Depot Switch is a combined FOP instruction leading to two external instructions to deliver and receive the same stock in and from different external account with one or more CSD/Custodians. Both external instructions must be linbked and monitored. The monitor function in the settlement process is allocated to various actors from several Groups depending on type of instruction.

element.name: 05:4:6:5 Capture, find matching allegement
element.documentation: Capture removal cancel allegement and try to match with received allegement with function new message.

element.name: 05:4:6:3 Determine type of match & inform client
05:4:5:3 Monitor& Manage Buy in on position
05:4:5:5 Support client Buy In auction
element.documentation:
Client are allowed to participate in a buy inn auction. Before entering the auction however it must be 100% sure that client and AAC can deliver the sold securites. Buy inn's must (oft) be delieverd same day.
Next to the voluntary process within the clearing processes there is a buy inn process to handle client instructions to deliver to a ccp when they don't have securities, this is the mandatory buy inn process.

element.name: 05:1 Recieve settlement instructions
element.documentation:
We receive settlement instructions from multiple sources. Per flow the capturing can differ. Sources that can deliver instructions are:
- Client portals
- Employee portals
- Intercompany channels
- Clearing processes
- Corporate action processes
- B&L processes
- Treasury processes

element.name: 05:1:3:4 Configure Instruction according Market rule definitions
05:1:1:0 Receive & Enrich Instruction
element.documentation: This process also triggers New ISIN Registration Process when we receive a Security for which no ISIN exists.

element.name: 05:1:2:0 Split or nett Instruction
element.documentation: This process will split client instructions if for external instructing more than one external instruction is required. The process handles settlement conversions and creates the for this service all required instructions (Dump, DVP/RVP/FOP/Depot Switch/Paymnet instruction). The process also establish an unique link between the original and N external instructions that is also used in the pre-settlement monitor process. If the source of a instruction is the Clearing process this process selects the netted client trades offered per exchange/settlement account and ISIN and determines and nett these external instruction when needed to reflect the external settlement.

element.name: 05:1:2:1:2 Apply SPD rules
element.documentation: When no direct link is available between depots instructions will be vreated to reroute the instruction over other csd/custodian to reach its destination. Activity will be performed by the Special product Desk (SPD).

element.name: 05:1:5:3 Store Physical Security in Tempory Vault
05:1:8 Settlement Instruction capture fee processing
element.documentation: Instruction and cancellation fee is charged

element.name: 05:1:1:1:1:2 Process CA adjusted intructions
element.documentation: This process will cancel original instruction and re-enter the CA adjusted instruction. For this process no additiona fee will be applicable.

element.name: 05:1:5:8 Store Physical Certificates in BCC Vault
05:1:1:1:3:1 Handle Cxl/Reversal Instruction
element.documentation:
This Process looks up the original instruction,
For a cancel:
A) when status is still unsettled a in or external cancel request is generated.
B) when settled has taken place the cancel instruction is rejected and a trigger to informe that his instruction is to late to cancel is generated.
For reversal
On Basis of the original instruction a reverse instruction is generated.

element.name: 05:1:2:1:7 Receive cancel & look up depotswitch legs
05:1:5:9 Post NOSTRO transfer temp Vault to Vault
05:1:3:2 Maintain Bypass STP check & Market Enrichments rules
05:7 Process Reverse instruction custodian
element.documentation:
In exeptional cases it can ne possible that a custodian notifies us that an settlement did not take place. We will notify the client of this event. Two options are then possib:
1: The instruction is reopened as settlement is still possible.
2: The instruction will be withdrawn out of the settlement process.

element.name: 05:7:4 Process Client cancel request
element.documentation: Clients can request to cancel their outstanding settlement instruction. This process deals with the cancel request.

element.name: 05:5 Process cancelations
element.documentation: As long as an instruction is not settled the client has the opportunity to cancel the instruction. If we receive a cancel request we will contact the custodian first to ask if the instruction is still unsettled and can be cancelled. When this is not the case we will report a "to late to cancel" message to the client.

element.name: 05:5:9 Settlement Fee process
element.documentation: For late settlements an other fee can be applicable, fee module must be able to see difference.

element.name: 05:5:2:6 Monitor Allegement & initiate return
element.documentation: Client has a predifined time frame in which he can react and sent a allegement instruction to match the received securities. When time is past and no allegement is received the returned process will be triggred to return securities to sender.

element.name: 05:5:2:5 Create Instruction according to dump Agreement
05:5:5 Select Instructions/ trades due for settlement
05:5:2:3 Find Matching (Dump) Instruction
element.documentation:
Process tries to find a matching client instruction for a received securities position. Outcome off process can be four situations.
1- Matching Instruction found and allocation to client made. Instruction and received securities are linked and can be settled
2- No Matching Instruction found, client is identified and has a dump agreement.
3- No matching instruction found, client is identified but has no dump agreement in place.
4- No Matching Instruction and client found -> Securities must be returned

element.name: 05:2 Evaluate settlement instruction
element.documentation: Check validity of the instruction. A client must be able to fulfill his obligations, he must either have cash, securities or an B&L service agreement. If a client goes short he must have checked availability first and reserved securities. The instruction will then be booked with the right value dates as upcomming obligation. Also fees and external service charges will be calculated and made ready for posting.

element.name: 05:2:2:2 Determine evaluation sequence receipts
element.documentation: Process determine sequence a.o. on basis biggest settlement amount. oldest instruction etc.

element.name: 05:2:2:0 Check Positions
element.documentation: When for same client in same ISIN on same depot settlement has be done the waiting instruction will be offered again to the settlement check process.

element.name: 05:2:3 Set Step rules settlement
element.documentation: Incl POA rules

element.name: 05:2:2:8 Set cash account assignment
element.documentation: A client can have more cash accounts, this process can link cash accounts for credit chewck re

element.name: 05:2:2:4:1 Look for settlements client with negative balance
05:0:0 Settlement Service
element.documentation: Act to get securities delivered and received between settlement parties and to assure that rights attached to the securities at trade date (e.g. dividend) are settled as well.

element.name: 04:0 Clear financial instruments
element.documentation:
Post trade and CCP related processing
http://10.250.85.137/display/IEMS1740/IT+Europe+-+MICS+NG+17.40+Home
http://10.250.85.137/display/IEMS1740/MICS+NG+17.40+Functional+designs

element.name: 04:6 Settle/end cleared transactions
element.documentation: The lifetime of a derivative is limited. This processes handle the various events which closes the cleared postion

element.name: 04:6:1 Allocate nett settlement to outstanding trades
element.documentation: To reduce risk and to create an efficient process a CCP settles in most cases on GCM/account level. This means that the settlement is a netted sum over all ourstanding trades. Per account financial instrument one position is settled. Per account currency one cash amount is settled. As AACB registers the trades and only closes the trades at settlement the single netted external settlement must be allocated to the belonging transaction. This process deals with the allocation on trade level.

element.name: 04:6:2 Settle derivative contracts
element.documentation:
Derivatives contracts have a limited life time after which they expire. This process deals with the contract expiry. Sub processes:
-Inform client of upcomming expiry
-Automatic exercise of in the money positions
-Cash settlement for cash settled derivatives
-Expire contract/position and remove position after set expiry time

element.name: 04:1 Nett trades for CCP settlement
element.documentation: Netting takes place on various levels and accounts. The relation between the various netted levels on client level and street side account level must be maintained. The external settlement must always be related to the underlyning trades. Especially with securitirs whereas partial settlement is possible this is of importance as here the netted external settlement must be divided over the trades.

element.name: 04:7:0 Synthetic products processing
element.documentation: AACB provide selected clients a synthetic product offer. Client trade in name of AACB in the ULV, when an order is executed AACB will issue a synthetic to the client and direct the ULV to is hedge book covering the position. With a synthetic AACB offers it's client a complete hedged financial instruments (Synthetic). The processes within this group deals with the issueing and maintence of these instruments.

element.name: 04:7:2 Calculate financing costs synthetic contracts
element.documentation: This process will charge the bearinger costs for the ULV of the synthetic contracts to the clients

element.name: 04:7:3 Handle synthetic products lifecycle events
element.documentation: If an corporate action takes place on the ULV this process will change the Synthetic contract to match the ULV and hedged position

element.name: 04:7:5 Manage Synthetics hedgebook
element.documentation: Overall clients AACB maintains the hedgebook. This hedgebook is managed over this process.

element.name: 04:7:1 Create/mutate/enrich synthetic contract
element.documentation: If a trade is received AACB will book the trade to the hedgebook and create (issue) or redeem a Synthetic contract.

element.name: 04:7:4 Request fee & service charges
element.documentation: This process will communicate with the fee billing process to trigger applicable fees for clients.

element.name: 04:4 Give up & take up processing
element.documentation: Gife up/Take ups are trades a market participant (client of ours) let do by a broker on a regulated market. The broker trades under his own name and licence and in first instance the trades areregistererd by the broker and his GCM. As the market participant wants/must have the rade in his book before the end of trading day the give up / take up process is created to faciliated this. The broker does a give up and the market participant does the take up or vice versa dependent if it is a position opening or closing. The instructing process is done between all participants within the chain Broker/ client , GCM and CCP. the instruction is done via decidated software/GUI. Afetr acknowledgement the aproved and validated give up or take up is done via messages follwoing the normal GTC channals.

element.name: 04:2 Calculate Margin for outstanding position
element.documentation: To cover CCP risk a GCM must provide margin to a CCP. This set of processes deals with the regisatrtion of margin obligations on client level.

element.name: 04:2:1 Initial margin calculation
element.documentation: To cover the price risk in cleared positions CCP requires GCM's to cover this risk by pleging a collateral account. This process deals with the registartion of the collateral obligation for initial marging per CCP on client level.

element.name: 04:2:1:4:3 Check if client uses own collateral
04:2:1:9 Calculate client collateral requirement
element.documentation: Process compare calculated margin required versus avalible collateral. Results will be shown in CVM report. Client can withdraw surplus, this is normal FOP securities request or as cash payment request. As this concenr collateral accounts the ptocedure is that risk must approve withdrawels. Un case client has lack of collateral he is obliged to deposit additional collateral same day. When this does not takeplace the normal risk default process will be follwoed.

element.name: 04:2:1:4:4 Validate CCP position at risk data
04:2:2 Vama calculation
element.documentation: To cover risks CCP and GCM's run certain derivatievs requrie a daily settlement of the position against closing price. This is called variation margin (VAMA). The settlement can result in a cash in or outflow. This process handles the bppking of Variation margin on client level.

element.name: 04:3 Handle specific contract events on cleared instruments
element.documentation:
Handled financial life cycle events on cleared transactions, contracts and open positions
A.o. Generic: Adjustments, Position transfers, Expiration
Specific: Energy Cascade, IRS compression,

element.name: 04:3:2:8 Request Regulation cash balance FX opposite party
04:3:2:2 Collect counterparty daily FX settlement data per currency
04:3:2:4 Compare settlement amount per counterparty/ currency
04:3:2:1 Collect AAC daily FX settlement data per currency and counterparty
04:3:2:3 Reclaim with counterparty missing FX settlement details
04:3:3:6 Determine if pre advice for receivable amount is necessary
04:3:3:2 Request counterparty expired NDF settlement details
04:5:3 Handle bounced or exceptions ex/as (tender) abandonment
04:5:1 Capture and validate exercise/ assignment/abandonment (tender) instruction
04:5:7:0 Create postings for booking ex/as tender derivatives and create ULV postings
04:5:5:0 Determine type of processing and see if external instruction is needed
04:5:4:1:1 Request client ex/as delivery choice (ad hoc or default)
04:5:1:1 Create auto-exericise of in the money option instructions
04:5:6:1:1:1 allocate abandont position to instructions and create posting
element.documentation: On some derivatives exchanges/ccp's it is possible to abandone (close) a options postion when it has no value anymore (deep out of tyhe money opions, oft short before expiry) or when the costs of an exercise are higher than the revenues.

element.name: 04:5:6:1:2 calculate assigned position if not equal
04:5:8:1 Check with OTC if external settlement has taken place
04:5:4:1:0 Handle & Monitor ex/as with delivery choice
04:5:6:1:0 Handle ex/as CCP with nett GCM position
element.documentation: With some CCP's/exchanges like LME options our GCM position is hold on a nett GCM base. No separaration on lower trading member levels exist. If we exercise and we as GCm are also assigned we only receive the netted result of this overall ex/as impact. This result we must break down again based on the confirmed exercises we sent to the CCP to get insigt into possible assigments. The assignemeed positions is threated next following the normal channals.

element.name: 04:5:7:1 Check if client is an offsetting client
04:5:7:2 Create also postings for offset admin and add/deduct option premium original trade from ULV trade
22:0 Corporate Actions Processing
element.documentation: Administrate and process the effect(s) related to the positions of our clients of any event that brings material change to a company?s securities or creates rights related to it. This involves change in position, money or securities movements deriving from that position, capturing incoming instructions from customers (or use customers standing instructions) and sending instructions to custodians and CSDs.

element.name: 22:02:3:0 Matching
element.documentation: Compare the received announcements with the ?golden copy?

element.name: 22:02:3:3:0 Handle Mismatch
element.documentation: Processing in case the values in the received announcement differ from the values in the golden copy

element.name: 22:02:3:2:0 Classify match
element.documentation: If announcement is marked as duplicate .... Process stops

element.name: 22:02:1:4 Validate announcement
element.documentation:
Validations done:
Do we know information vendor
Do we know financial instrument

element.name: 22:02:4:0 Check new back valued security positions
element.documentation: Check if announcement exist, when yes check if event exists, when no trigger resent Golden announcement

element.name: 22:02:1:2:1:0 Manual Announcement creation & modification
element.documentation: Events cannot be created directly, instead an announcement needs to be created. The announcement follows the same validations and processing logic as any other announcement.

element.name: 22:02:1:5 Store Announcement
element.documentation: Registration of all incoming announcements (new, update, update incl entitlements, cancellation, withdrawal, reminder etc.)

element.name: 22:02:1:3 Map to internal event type
element.documentation: Requirement CA046: Mapping from external event type to internal event type for each custodian (initial set-up).

element.name: 22:02:2:2:0 Filter duplicate Announcements
element.documentation: Requirement CA060: Rule to filter out duplicate messages (e.g. in case we have more than one account at same custodian)

element.name: 22:02:2:0 Check if Announcement already exist

element.name: 22:07:5:1 Request Client Tax Voucher from custodian
element.documentation:
For German dividend payments as of 1 January 2012, the withholding taxes (KEST, SOLZ) will be fully processed by the depository bank of the client. These new rules apply to stocks, funds and accumulating funds.
However, in case the depository bank of the respective securities is located outside Germany, the withholding tax amounting to 26.375% (25% KEST and 5.5% SOLZ) will be withheld by the last German depository bank in the chain. This process is meant to ensure that the appropriate tax is also levied in an international context.
ABN AMRO Clearing Bank NV is seen as a Dutch resident bank for German withholding tax purposes. This implies that the taxes will be withheld by the last German custodian in the chain, i.e. Clearstream Banking Frankfurt (CBF).
CBF will pay the net dividend amount to AACB which will subsequently pass on these dividends to you as a client. We will provide you with credit advices accordingly. Only the custodian who has actually withheld the taxes is allowed to issue corresponding tax vouchers. We will therefore send a request for issuing tax vouchers to CBF on your behalf.
What does this mean for you?
Clients having long positions in German securities will receive the net dividend amount.
The reports you receive from AAB/AACB may not be used as a tax voucher to reclaim German withholding tax. For that purpose, you will receive via us a specific tax voucher prepared by our German custodian. However, we are only allowed to request such tax voucher 30 days after ex-date as the custodian will take into account settlements within this period. We are currently negotiating the prices of this service with them and will report to you accordingly.
Clients having (settled as well as unsettled) short positions in German securities will be debited for the gross amount of the dividends.
Accumulating Funds (ETF)
Different rules will apply for accumulating mutual funds residing in Germany.
Technically, these accumulating mutual funds once a year pay a gross dividend to their shareholders who re-invest the net amount into the fund again. Economically, this was done by only paying the withholding taxes to the German tax authorities. No corporate action was registered.
The funds themselves are not allowed anymore to withhold the taxes. That should, starting 1 January 2012, be the custodian bank of the shareholder of the funds.
Accumulating funds are supposed to have a deemed dividend distribution at year-end of the fund. It is therefore foreseen that the Funds will be obliged to pay the amount of withholding tax to the paying agent bank/custodian bank as tax distribution i.e.?LiquiditÃ¤tssteuer?. The standard withholding tax amounts to 26.375% (KEST, SOLZ). We abstain from ?Kirchensteuer?.
What does this mean for you?
Clients having long positions in German accumulating mutual funds will receive no dividend amount (26.375% less 26.375%). However, these clients may receive tax vouchers on their economical positions. This last one will be provided to you by i.e. CBF. This tax voucher can be used to make a reclaim in Germany as well as to claim a tax credit in your own tax return.
We are currently negotiating the details with our custodians i.e. CBF for the format of as well as pricing for this service.
With such tax voucher, you may start a reclaim procedure to get a reclaim for the amount of withholding taxes paid exceeding the appropriate tax treaty rates.
Clients having (settled as well as unsettled) short positions in German accumulating mutual funds will be debited for the gross amount of the tax distribution.
ADR shares
Clients which trade in ADR shares should pay additional attention to the new German regulations.
Based upon the current interpretation of the rules today, it may well be that on ADR shares with German underlying stock held in custody via a German custodian; German withholding tax will be levied twice. Accordingly you will receive two tax vouchers. However, it is unclear whether the home country is willing to give a tax credit twice.

Order the meal you want, and it will be delivered to your door. You will have to provide your own plates etc

Order the ingredients you want, and they will be delivered to your door. You have to make the meal yourself.

Menu

Description
The comprehensive details of what each request will contain. We use this common language to make sure we get your order right, and to know what you mean if something needs changed
Serving 3
Recipe (you have access to: Regulatory Calculations Library & Theoretical Pricing Library)
Lets you cook the meal yourself, but you have to provide your own ingredients.
