03:0 Client Cash position management
element.documentation:
Maintain client cash position administration.
Cash can be stored in the external world on multiple external cash accounts in various timezones having multiple interest conditions. To express this a money "depot" should be added over which various interest conditions can be set. No overall netting as present.

element.name: 03:5:0 Calculate interest
element.documentation: Calculate client interest on the various interest bearing balances

element.name: 03:5:4 calculate call and deposito interest
element.documentation: Calculated the contractual call and deposito interest

element.name: 03:5:1:1 Calculate interests on (sub) accounts
element.documentation:
Calculate current account interest on client (sub) accounts.
Client can play bank towards his internal account/sub account structure whereas he uses own interest %. The calculated interest are booked in the individual (sub) account on the one side and on the other side to to the appointed client internal master account. For us the booking is neutral as both dt and cr booking is done within the client. We calculate client interest on overall client level.

element.name: 03:5:3:0 Calculate short stock interest
element.documentation: Calculate overall short stock interest on client level

element.name: 03:5:2:0 Calculate initial margin interest
element.documentation: Calculate Clearing margin intereston client level

element.name: 03:5:1:0 Calculate interest on client
element.documentation: Calculate current account interest on client level

element.name: 03:5:2:1 calculate interest on (sub) accounts.
element.documentation: Calculate clearing margin interest on (sub) account and CCP level

element.name: 03:5:3:1 Calculate short stock interest on (sub) accounts.
element.documentation: Calculate per (sub) account short position or fixed contract the required short stock interest

element.name: 03:2:0 Calculate and reserve cash positions
element.documentation: Process cash events and calculated the new cash position (per currency and on various client account levels)

element.name: 03:3:0 Valuate cash position
element.documentation: We maintain accounts in various currencies. Securities position valuations are also done using the instruments default currency. For different purposes we want to know the total value calculated in the set default/home currency. This process calculates the countervalue of the foreign currencies vlaues in the set home currency and provides a single value for overall position on vasious levels.

element.name: 03:7:0 Handle unidenfied posting on our external accounts
element.documentation: We can receive money for which we do not have a matching instruction. This must be identified within a set time frame (24H). If it is not booked to the right client his netliq and risk position is not correct. When the money does not belong to us or our clients we must sent it back to the sender.

34:2:2:2:1:0 MAR Monitoring
element.documentation:
The MAR (Market Abuse regulation) and CSMAD (Criminal Sanctions for Market Abuse Directive) succeeded the MAD in july 2016. It is more or less an update that strengthens the existing MAD framework to ensure market integrety and investor protection. MAR now includes new markets and instruments, CSMAD pertains solely the sanctions by EU member states.
Market Abuse Regulation addresses:
Insider Trading Buying or selling financial instruments, or advising or instructing someone else to do so, when in possession of inside information information of a precise nature which has not been made public, relating, directly or indirectly, to one or more issuers of financial instruments or to one or more financial instruments and which, if it were made public, would be likely to have a significant effect on the prices of those financial instruments or on the price of related derivative financial instruments?; Market Manipulation Creating a false or misleading impression about financial instruments or their issuers by distorting the market, often by price manipulation
-transactions or orders to trade which give, or are likely to give, false or misleading signals as to the supply of, demand for or price of financial instruments, or; which secure, by a person, or persons acting in collaboration, the price of one or several financial instruments at an abnormal or artificial level; -transactions or orders to trade which employ fictitious devices or any other form of deception or contrivance; -dissemination of information through the media, or the Internet, or by any other means, which gives, or is likely to give, false or misleading signals at to financial instruments, including the dissemination of rumors and false or misleading news, where the person who made the dissemination knew, or ought to have known, that the information was false or misleading.
Suspicious Trades or Trading Patterns (Single Trader) -Bear Raid. Taking over a company by manipulating its stock price, by first selling (to lower the price) and then repurchasing at the at the lower price -Capping. Manipulating stock prices in order to influence the exercise of an existing options position -Pegging. Manipulating the price of a stock (raising or maintaining) in order to influence the exercise of an existing options position -Manipulation Prior to the Pricing of Related Products ? Manipulating certain stocks that influence the price of other stocks or related financial products -Mini-Manipulation. Manipulating the price of an option on a stock by manipulative trading in the underlying stock -Overtrading (Securities Taken in trade) ? If a broker-dealer purchases (or arranges the purchase of) securities taken in trade (swaps) not at the then current fair market price. Such purchases are usually for a fixed price offering -Wash Sale ? Giving the false impression of high trading volume by buying and selling the same stock at the same price (often through the same broker dealer) -Improper Execution. As opposed to "Best Execution", the execution at unfair prices, such that the buyer (seller) does not incur the lowest (highest) reasonable cost. Improper execution can be due to an improper spread ( the difference between the inter-dealer best bid and the best offer); an improper markup (the amount charged to the buyer's cost in a principal trade over the best inter-dealer offer); or an improper markdown (the amount deducted from the seller?s proceeds below the highest inter-dealer bid)
Patterns where multiple individuals or companies are involved: -Acting in Concert. Two or more persons working together to gain control of a company or manipulate the price of a security. -Cornering the Market. Two or more persons working together to inflate the price of a security by acquiring a large position. -Collusion. Two or more persons working together to create a false impression of market activity or to fraudulently interfere with supply and demand. -Daisy Chain. A pattern of fictitious trades for purposes of market manipulation by a group, who profits after a "bailout" by an unsuspecting person. -Front-Running. Someone with knowledge of an imminent material buy or sell transaction, in order to profit from the information by trading ahead. -Insider Trading. Someone with knowledge of material non-public information, who profits from the information by trading on it. -Parking. Hiding the true ownership of securities by creating a set of fictitious transactions or trades. -Pre-Arranged Trades. Transactions in which the price, terms or contra-side have been pre-arranged and not subject to normal market risk. -Year-End and As-of Trades. Transactions executed in order to establish gains or losses for tax purposes or to conceal portfolio losses or true positions from regulators, accountants, or auditors. -Marking the Close. Transactions executed at or just before the market close to print favorable prices for inappropriate purposes, such as inflating position valuations or avoiding margin calls -Rumors. Starting or spreading rumors in order to influence the price of a stock -Short Squeeze. Persons who sell short a security paying inflated prices, because the price of the stock was inflated by someone cornering the market
Regulatory Challenges -Composition of behavior profile per customer, trader or account based on historical transaction data -Fine tuning of press releases and other price sensitive information and relating to specific companies and/or trading companies -Based on generated real-time alerts looking for "hidden" company news. Equal Information Principles. -Quick adaption of business rules for alert generation. Uniform approach for all users.
Full Markets History To do quick and comprehensive queries. Integrating different sets of data and connect in quiries (Alternative Instrument Identifiers & ISIN-codes) Advanced scenarios based on predefined Market Abuse activity with standard alerting formats. External signals Alerts based on business rules Monitor all financial instruments (not just cash markets) Connecting publicly available data to existing case management Research directly aimed at accounts, traders/trading firms and/or customers. Manager alerts per identifier. Case building through research and investigation Link analyse. Unique matching of relationships between accounts, traders/trading firms and/or customers to generate alerts and cases.

11:1:0 Communication & channel management
element.documentation:
Arranges and monitors connectivity with Object+ UFG and Exchange Gateways.
Functional requirements
- 24/7 unattended operation is supported
- All data streams are stored persistently in a database
- The recovery point of data streams is the responsibility of the exchange connector. The exchange connector provides data output recovery and restart for all data streams. This is realized with an internal sequence number logic, that allows for independent recoverability of the output data streams. The UFG only provides recovery and restart of a certain data stream if it is supported by the exchange/CCP connection or in the UFG itself with a persistent data store. Currently the sequence numbering in the output data storage (TaSC database table) is used.
- In case of data stream errors (UFG sequencing, formatting, validation, etc.) STP (Straight Through Processing) is maintained as much as possible with proper handling and logging of exceptions
- A GUI for maintenance of the configuration data
The following technical requirements apply:
- For receiving data from the Exchanges, the UFG interface communication is implemented. For sending data the following output destinations are supported: database, file, web services and message queue
- An exchange connector core functionality is developed that is independent from the exchange specific functionality. A (new) exchange connection is based on the core functionality with additional implementation of exchange specific functionality and configuration
- The implementation of the exchange connector should not require any changes in the target systems TaSC and MICS
- The exchange connector should be deployable as a separate software component independently from the TaSC components
- Each exchange/CCP connection can be deployed on any application and/or database server. System scalability is provided per exchange/CCP connection, because for certain data streams (like trades), the correct message sequence is essential in case of cancellations and updates.
- GUI authentication and authorization is supported
- Cleanup of the output data storage (database table and file) and duplicate data checking is not required.

element.name: 11:1:3 Monitor Communication sessions
element.documentation:
A connector may show the status of particular signals, which are issued by the exchange during the day. After receipt of a signal a connector may invoke special functionality like subscribing to a data stream or breaking the interface to execute some configured actions (e.g. file copy). In the GUI the connectors show statistics/status information of the exchange interface, services, subscriptions and signals. In this way operators can verify whether a connector is still running correctly. At exchange interface level the total number of received messages are shown and an inactivity interval. At service / subscription level the following data is shown:
- total number of message received/stored for the service/subscription
- timestamp of last received/stored message for the service/subscription
- last sequence number received for the service/subscription
The connector contains functionality to log specific events which are important for operational/maintenance purposes. Furthermore it is possible to trace incoming and outgoing messages. The tracing level, which can be configured, determines the detail of tracing.

element.name: 11:1:0 Maintain connectivity
element.documentation: Process to set up, start and end connections with known counterparties based on existing contracts to exchange data.

element.name: 11:1:1 Maintain connector configuration
element.documentation: Set up and maintain configurations for the individual connections

element.name: 11:1:1 Maintain Connector configuration
element.documentation: Process enables to sub-scribe to services. A service offers the possibility to subscribe to a data stream (like Trade Capture Reports, Market data). A service may support subscriptions (like subscriptions on exchange member level (e.g. applicable for Eurex, Xetra). The services/subscriptions to which a connector subscribes are configurable (configuration file).

element.name: 11:1:2:0 Maintain individual communication gateway sessions
element.documentation:
Function must have Start/Stop interface with user to manual override or trigger the communication session. Connectors may start in attended or unattended mode. In attended mode operators are able to control the connector manually. This means that no functionality of the connector will be invoked automatically. The operators may start the connectors using this mode in case of operational issues like connection problems etc. Normally, however, a connector is started in unattended mode. This means that the connector performs all necessary actions automatically (like subscribing to services, performing breaks, etc.). It uses the business calendar functionality of TaSC to determine whether it can be started on a specific business date.
The connector contains functionality to break the exchange interface in order to execute specific actions (e.g. for copying a file). After performing the action(s), the connector resumes its normal processing. The connectors support scheduling of specific actions, such as performing breaks, subscribing to a service or performing a check whether all data streams are complete. The connectors contain functionality to trigger data stream subscriptions based on a signal (e.g. OMX margins ready signal), end of stream (e.g. Eurex products) or scheduled times (e.g. OMX client positions).

element.name: 11:2:4:0 Log Security operational data
element.documentation: the process for generating, transmitting, storing, analyzing, and disposing of computer security log data. Log management is essential to ensuring that computer security records are stored in sufficient detail for an appropriate period of time. Routine log analysis is beneficial for identifying security incidents, policy violations, fraudulent activity, and operational problems. Logs are also useful when performing auditing and forensic analysis, supporting internal investigations, establishing baselines, and identifying operational trends and long-term problems.

element.name: 11:2:1:8:1 Kill User session
element.documentation: This process enables a supervisor role to end (kill) a user session. Sometimes needed from compliance or operational point of view. In some system's a batch can only run when all users have left the system, if a user forgets to log out the user must be killed.

09:0 Borrow & Lending Service
element.documentation: Borrow securities for short selling BCC clients and lend surplus position to the market. The borrowing will be primarily internal, using long positions of BCC clients to cover for short positions of BCC clients. If demand and supply can not be covered internally BCC will put the request trough to GSFG or search in the market for opportunities itself. GSFG also takes care of the lending of unused long positions in the market. On one hand this facilitates customer trading opportunities and a smooth settlement of trades. On the other hand it generates extra income on clients? long positions (or lowered clearing fees). This also covers the management of borrowed and lend positions including recalls.

element.name: 09:5:0 Availability check stock to borrow
element.documentation:
This process services clients which want to sell if they do not have positions (naked short selling). The regulator requests that the client first checks availability before sending the sell order, even when it is ot the intention of the client to have an overnight short position which requires real borrowing of securities.
The process can also create a trigger for a hard reservation of stock for opening a new client B&L contract

element.name: 09:5:1:0 Capture LA available stock
element.documentation: At the start of day the available securities position will be captured from external parties (starting with GSFG).

element.name: 09:5:2 Prepare LA overview
element.documentation: Once validation has taken place and the LA and file format and date are correct, the file is prepared for use, adjusting to one uniform format with all the same product short names. Now the available position has been determined.

element.name: 09:5:4:0 Look up available borrow pool
element.documentation: After authentication, the request of the client is matched with the available position.

element.name: 09:5:7:2 Set LA overview validation rule
element.documentation: Set-up rules of content for the LA securities availability file, minimum requirements (ISIN, short name, quantity).

element.name: 09:5:4:1 In case of pool defecit request market
element.documentation: If the position is not available according to the overview the client request is forwarded by the SB&L department which will send out an LA availability request to external LA?s to determine securities availability. The LA availability response is received, either there are securities available or not. The response will be registered in the ?Market availability check log?. If the position is not available with other external LA?s the client will receive a ?Client impossible to borrow notification?.

element.name: 09:5:6:0 Clean time zone reservations
element.documentation: At the end of the day the available securities position and reservations are cleaned, so next day can be started with a new overview. The position of to day and the request are saved as history.

element.name: 09:5:5 Reserve available borrow stock
element.documentation: If position is available according to our available position or with other external LA?s the position will be reserved and the client will receive a Client borrow reservation/possibility notification which he can use as audit trail in case of regulatory questions for naked short selling. The position will be blocked in the securities availability overview show it will no longer be displayed to other clients.

element.name: 09:5:3:1 Authenticate & Authorise client
element.documentation: In the step the client will be authenticated as one of our clients allowed to do this request.

element.documentation: Set-up Lending agents that are allowed to deliver files with available securities position.

element.name: 09:5:1:1 Validate LA availabilty overview
element.documentation: This Lending Agent (LA) and the file content will be validated

element.name: 09:5:3:0 Capture borrow reservation request
element.documentation: On receive of a client borrowing reservation request (either one ISIN or a complete list) the client capture of the request is started

element.name: 09:5:7:3 Set LA overview preparation rules
element.documentation: Set-up rules to harmonize output provided to in the securities availability file, minimum requirements (LA, ISIN, short name, quantity)

element.name: 09:2:02 Handle unsure long transaction
element.documentation: Buy trades can also be market unsure on trade level when one thinks the trade will not settle. In this case no compensation will take place and the upcoming buy will not be taken in the borrow-forecast calculation.

The system will only import trades for which the B&L indicator on client level is set to Y. This applies for long and short trades. So be careful, you do not see all open unsettled trades in the MICS system via this screen. Only for B&L relevant trades are shown so you can mark these trades for unsure.

element.name: 09:2:06 Request - Pay Off

When we import intraday trade info via B&L requirement Clearing Member all validated but not yet sent requests and pay off?s are set back in status to screen Check and validation of B&L proposal. element.name: 09:2:05 Create, Update or delete internal contracts
09:2:10 Reconcile B&L ref data
element.documentation:
The B&L system is closely linked with the MICS system. Most data is updated during the night batch process. The B&L system requires certain data fields filled which it gets from the MICS system. When this data is not correctly filled the B&L system can?t work. An example from such a data field is the ISIN code. The B&L system works on basis off ISIN. When an ISIN code is not filled in the MICS system the B&L system can?t process. To overcome this problem we need to run reconciliation on a daily basis. This reconciliation can be started out of the MICS main menu, reference data, and product consistency control. This process will create a report called MMVIJ. The report is also known as validity of input journal. After processing the report can be printed out of the MICS main menu, option Miscellaneous, print validity of input report. When you want to print this report the system ask you to enter a starting time and an end time. This is important, as the report is a process log. All log entries are stored. If you run the reconciliation process new log entries can be made. Running the process twice will also create new log entries. If your time window is too large all entries will be shown, also the entries from data, which is already cleaned.
The report is showing logs from inconsistent data. This inconsistency must be taken out off the system first before the process in the B&L system can continue. Inconsistencies can be:
? Missing ISIN?s, need to be corrected ion the MICS product tables in the MICS reference data,
? Missing product country codes, need to be entered in the Symbol Depot Account Country table in the MICS reference data menu.
Also after processing a data file from a lending agency one needs to print the MMVIJ report in the way described above. This is to check whether the lending agency did provide us with consistent data we can process. When the report shows inconsistencies we need to inform the lending agency about this and ask them to change the data to the required format. We can process reprocess the file when the lending agency is able to resent it or in some cases we can change the wrong data ourselves (loan rates f.e.)
It can also be that we enter new reference data like client accounts in MICS. These accounts also need to be reflected within the B&L system. This can be done over the B&L reference menu option Import MICS reference data.
The option B&L requirement Clearing Member has two meanings in the B&L system, it starts the calculation needed to update figures within the B&L system and it will import data which is entered intraday in the MICS system.

The option B&L requirement Clearing Member has two meanings in the B&L system, it starts the calculation needed to update figures within the B&L system and it will import data which is entered intraday in the MICS system.

element.documentation: Clients can be grouped to a client group. In this case the system sees this client group as one for borrow and lending purposes and will net all trades which are not market unsure to a netted obligation

element.name: 09:1:4:2 Set opposite party priority
element.documentation:
One can set a settlement priority for an opposite party. The system will than propose to use the newly available stock to be used to deliver first to the trades belonging to the opposite party with the highest priority. The functionality can be of interest when one can only partial borrow stock one and non-deliveries will result in a fine for the customer for trades over this opposite party. The blocking and releasing from the trades need to be done manual on basis of this advice in the settlement systems.
This functionality is present not used.

element.name: 09:1:3:2 LA instruction maintenance
element.documentation: Communication to and from Lending agents can be processed automatically. This functionality can be set per lending agency. Also is it possible to automatic reconcile position and contract data with a Borrowing Agent.

element.name: 09:1:1:4 Set B&L interest rise
element.documentation:
Client fees need to be entered in the MICS system under Interest Rise NCM. We need to use interest type S (short stock) and enter OT (other) for exchange code and symbol. In this case the system will take the entered rate for all products.
!! When no rate has been entered on client level no calculation will be made and the client will not be charged for his borrows. For that please always check if a client rate exists. You can check this in the main MICS system, reference data, interest rise NCM.

element.name: 09:1:2:1 Block for Internal lending

The functionality can be used when stock is hard to borrow or in the case corporate actions occur. When used the system will only propose to borrow external

element.documentation: Funding is the act of providing financial resources, usually in the form of money. In this respect both the use of internal reserves to generate cash as well as the financing by acquiring capital from external sources to create liquity for AAC's business is meant. Funding desk decide what is needed, they prescribe what is needed. They do not execute themself, this done by Treasury Trading desk that has the mandate for execution. In this way a function separation between is installed. The tarding activities are adminisatrted at yet another desk.

21:0 Customer Collateral Management
element.documentation: Act to manage securities and cash being used by customers as pledge for their initial margin obligations. The service can be expanded to an automated regulation to handle the clients external pledged collateral. Autometed in this respect means the client provides us with a standing instruction after which we provide the daily service. Based on the risk position of the customer, collateral is collected or refunded. This also covers the management of the relation between the kinds of collateral that can be used for a specific position (instrument). This service also covers the add on client service to manage clients collateral at third parties, with BCC as the agent.

element.name: 33:0 Operational Risk Management
element.documentation: Calculate and monitor the risk of loss resulting from inadequate or failed internal processes, people and systems, or from external events.

element.name: 33:5:0 Information Security Review Process
element.documentation:
1. The Information Security Management process describes the definition, process and instruments (e.g. Security Check and Vulnerability Scanning) that must be used for identifying security requirements, gaps, threats and vulnerabilities.
2. Information Security review, analysis and testing must be carried out on IT assets and IT systems:
a. Periodically, but at least: • Annually for Crown Jewels. • Every 2 years for other IT assets and IT systems with a highly sensitive CIA rating. • Every 3 years for sensitive and non-sensitive IT assets and IT systems, using a risk-based approach.
3. The results must be captured and documented in a repository and shared with owners for information.
For more detail refer to the

element.name: 33:4:1 Collect risk events and audit results

05.0 Primary Products Settlement service
element.documentation: This service settles the transfer of ownership of a primary product as a result of a trade of transaction or it moves a primary product from on account (internal or external) to another of the same client. The settlement service allows clients to do OTC business, to move securities between depots, to exchange one security for another, to settle corporate actions or to process ex/as.

element.name: 05.2 Late settlement service (Penalty charging, Buy in)
05.1 CCP netting, settlement allocation & settlement service
07.0 (Proxy) Voting service
element.documentation: The proxy service provides clients with information regarding General or Annual General Meetings from issuing companies ((A)GM's) and with the ability to vote by proxy.

element.name: 06.0 Asset class Position administration service
element.documentation: This service calculates the specified position types for the specified view point and at defined moments in time. Recognised position types are: Legal (settled); Economic; End of day; End of (fiscal) year, at market close, expired position, overall Delta, unsettled or CCP outstanding, record day, ex-day, valuated, End of processing day/ book close. Position view points are: Client, Client account type, Client account, client sub-account, Outstanding counterparty, Depot or nostro accounts,Depot accpunt

element.name: 06.4 Physical securities and commodities custody service
element.documentation: This service provides the handling and custody for physical instruments and commodities.

element.name: 06.1 Assets Record keeping, Position calculation and valuation services
element.documentation: This service administrates all financial obligations and posessions our client and we have. It also provides insight in all required postion views. [example position views: legal, record day, ex day, economic, at market close, End of day, End of month, End of year, End of year taxation, valuated, balanced, non balanced/contract, FIFO, LIFO, Selected close out, per client, per counterparty, per custodian, within country XYZ, etc].

element.name: 35.0 Market & Reference data service
element.documentation: This service provides, maintains and distributes all reference and static data for the mentioned key data elements and it's attributes.

element.name: 35.2 Client data service
element.documentation: This service register all contractual and legal required client data.

element.name: 35.3 Counterparty data service
element.documentation: This service registerd all counterparty data.

element.name: 35.1 Financial Instrument information service
element.documentation: This service takes care of Fianancial instrument data management.

element.name: 35.1.1 Instrument data registration service
element.documentation: The instrument data service act as the golden source for all static reference data and identifiers regarding financial instruments.

element.name: 35.1.1 Instrument data registration service
element.documentation: The instrument data service act as the golden source for all static reference data and identifiers regarding financial instruments.

element.name: 35.1.2 Instrument Pricing service
element.documentation:
This service takes care of the pricing of financial instruments. An instrument can be priced in multiple markets. AACB can also get prices from multiple sources. these can be data vendors, exchanges or CCP's. For our reporting purposes one market per book will be appointed as the leading market for AACB's valuation. The service maintains the overview of the default price source.
In AACB's pricing policy it can be that different systems use different sources on purpose in other to validate the prices used. This is the case by the rpicing used for our system of records and the risk pricing. The risk system has a price compare check build in.

element.name: 35.4 Trading or affirmation platform data service
element.documentation: This service register all data relevant and contractualdata regarding platforms on which AACB or its clients are active.

element.name: 35.5 (sub) Account data service
element.documentation: AACB monitors it's clients on the highest level. Clients can however have the need to specify certain positions apart. AACB offers this service to it's clients by giving them the opportunity to set up dedicated (sub) accounts under ther main account for specific purposes. The client also has the option to set up own interest and fee arrangements for these (sub) accounts. In this case the billing is first done within the client on (sub) account level with the rates the clients requested. The result is booked to a dedicated (sub) account within the client. From this account the billing towards AACB is done against the contractual agreed rates. The result is left within the dedicated account. In this way a client can for instance use a interest spread towards it's tarders.

element.name: 09.0 SB&L service
element.documentation: This service offers clients the ability profit from a declining market by going short in a specific security. The client has the obligation to check the availability of the security first before going short. A client can also take a fixed contract, this is a lending contract tailored to his needs and arranged for that a clients executes his strategy.

element.name: 09.2 Fixed B&L service
element.documentation: This service offers clients to set up startegies and negoatiate conditions of a contract.

element.name: 09.3 B&L contract service
element.documentation: This service will maintain relations with external borrow agents, borrow stock with third parties for internal lending or treasury purposed , deal with the collateral requirements, manage transactional flow with lending agents and manage the external contract portfolio.

element.name: 09.3.1 SF Street side contract management service
09.3.2 Client side SF contract management service
09.4 Stock availability check service
element.documentation: This service provide clients with insight in the available stock for borrowing and provide the option to reserve this stock for short sellig purposes.

element.name: 09.1 automated B&L service
element.documentation: Within this service the clearing bank will, based on a contractual agrement, automatically act to cover a short position when noticed, it is however always still the clients obligation to check availability before going short.

element.name: 01.0 Global execution Services
element.documentation:
This service supports clients with order execution and management in the broadest sense.
Support client trading by either or combined providing: · tools to support trade execution (Trading Support Service), · connectivity to markets (Market Connectivity Services) · Supply trading memberships or legal trading frame works to execute transactions under name of AACB but for own risk (the frameworks can exist out of AACB Trading memberships or counterparty relations covered via ISDA agreements)

element.name: 01.1 Member hosting service
element.documentation: This service provide the client with tooling and means for order execution & management to the available markets and asset classes. A client can only trade in such market or instrument type after a formal approval.

element.name: 01.5 OMS access
element.documentation:
APAC only.
OMS = Order Management System

element.name: 01.2 Direct Market Access service
element.documentation: This service provide clients over offered order management systems (TT, Itiviti & Fidessa) global acces to financial markets in various asses classes whereas AACB acts as executing/introducing broker for their cleints.

element.name: 01.4 Advanced Execution Service (AES)
element.documentation: This service offer clients the ability to use our trading membership to execute orders on a trading place where we are already member.

element.name: 01.4.6 AES Best execution Monitoring
element.documentation: The [Best Executuin] order execution policy shall include, in respect of each class of fincnial intruments, information on the different veneus where the investment firm executes its cliet orders and teh factors affecting the choice of execution venue. It shall at least include those venues that enable the investment firm to obtain on a consistent bases the best possible result for the execution of client orders. Members shall require investment firms who execute client orders to summarise and make public on an annual basi, for each class of financial instruments, the top five eecution venues in terms of trading volumes whre they executed client orders in the preceding year and information on the quality of execution obtained. The execution factors to be taken into account are: price, costs, speed, likelihood of execution and settlement, size, nature of any other consideration relevant to the execution of an order.

element.name: 01.4.2 Smart Order Routing (SOR
element.documentation: Takes advantage of fragmented markets to provide clients with the best available price at the lowest available exchange fees

element.name: 01.3 Sponsored Access service
element.documentation: This service offer technical support towards market places

element.name: 34.2.1 Market Abuse monitoring service
element.documentation: Criminal insider dealing is an offence. TYhe offence can be related to insider dealing, unlawful disclosure, market manipulation and attempted manipulation. Bancs must by regulation monitor their business to track and report this behaviour. This service takes care of that.

element.name: 34.3 Applicable Regulation Track & trace service

element.name: 25.3.4 US 1042 Witholding reporting service
element.documentation:
US reporting obligation :About Form 1042, Annual Withholding Tax Return for U.S. Source Income of Foreign Persons
Use Form 1042 to report the following:
The tax withheld under chapter 3 on certain income of foreign persons, including nonresident aliens, foreign partnerships, foreign corporations, foreign estates, and foreign trusts.
The tax withheld under chapter 4 on withholdable payments.
The tax withheld pursuant to section 5000C on specified federal procurement payments.
Payments that are reported on Form 1042-S under chapters 3 or 4.

element.name: 25.3.3 US 1099 reporting service
element.documentation:
Tax Treatment of Treasury Securities
The same tax rules apply for all three types of Treasury securities. The interest paid on T-bills, T-notes, and T-bonds is fully taxable at the federal level, but is unconditionally tax-free for states and localities. The difference between the issue and maturity prices of T-Bills is classified as interest for this purpose.﻿
Investors who also realize profits or losses on Treasuries that they traded in the secondary markets must report short- or long-term capital gains and losses accordingly.﻿ Each year, the Treasury Department sends investors Form 1099-INT, which shows the taxable interest that must be reported on the 1040

element.documentation: Provide for the gathering and distribution of information to manage the service providing process.

element.name: 36.1 Planning & budget service

element.name: 36.2 Organisational alignment service
element.documentation: This service takes care of of the organisational alignment and coordination. This can be by creating reapeting structures (meetings, bila's etc) or by ad hoc and temporaty structures with as purpose to enhance, improve and ccordinate the effectivity and efficiancy of the overall organisation.

element.name: 36.3 Organisation set up service
element.documentation: This service provide and maintains the organisational set up to create and effecient and effective structure. It also defines, based on the organisational strategy, requirements to handle deviations to the existing set up and to provide input to service 38.

element.name: 20.0 Customer Risk management service
element.documentation: The customer risk service controls the client in real time. If deviations are noticed the client is request to correct his position. When the client get's in default the position is taken over by Risk and will be neutralized and liquidated.

element.documentation:
Financial Collateral Comprehensive Method (FCCM)
https://www.eba.europa.eu/regulation-and-policy/single-rulebook/interactive-single-rulebook/1794
Collateralising an exposure with financial collateral is one of the credit risk mitigation techniques used by banks to reduce the risk of credit exposures. There are three evaluation approaches for financial collateral that are prescribed in CRE22, one of which is the Financial Collateral Comprehensive Method (FCCM). The FCCM allows for a bank to benefit from all types of financial collateral whilst not requiring them to develop an internal model. However, in order to use the FCCM a bank should demonstrate that the prescribed haircuts are conservative. This presentation outlines two possible approaches to backtest the prescribed haircuts.

element.name: 24.02.23 CRS reporting services
element.documentation:
The Common Reporting Standard (CRS) is a centrally agreed, global standard for the automatic exchange of financial account information. CRS was created by the Organisation for Economic Cooperation and Development (OECD). Based on the learnings from the implementation of the FATCA legislation, it came into effect in a phased implementation on 1 January 2016.
What is the objective of CRS?
CRS has been designed to increase transparency about tax matters on a global scale. It requires financial institutions (FIs) to identify accounts held directly or indirectly by persons who are not tax residents in the country where their account is opened. If the FI is in a CRS Participating Jurisdiction, and the person opening the account is tax resident in another CRS participating jurisdiction, then the FI will report the account details to their local tax authority.
For example: A tax resident of the Netherlands (NL) opens a bank account with an FI in Switzerland (CH). Both NL and CH participate in the CRS. The FI will therefore report the account details to the tax authorities in CH, who will direct them to the tax authorities of NL.
Reportable persons for CRS are those who are tax resident in a location that is different to the banks location where they are opening an account. Tax residency is dependent on things such as where a customer lives or spends their time, and on any economic ties that the customer may have.
By law, a bank is unable to offer customers any advice on how to determine their tax residence. Check out OECD’s page for more information on country-specific guidance. If customers are unsure about any information when determining their tax residence, banks advise to speak to a tax advisor.

element.name: 24.02.10 SFTR reporting service
element.documentation:
Securities Financing Transactions Regulation. The SFTR focuses on increasing the transparency of rehypothecation and shadow banking. It does so by establishing new disclosure and reporting requirements for SFTs, which are defined as: • Repurchase transactions • Securities or commodities lending and securities or commodities borrowing • Buy-sell back or sell-buy back transactions • Margin lending transactions. It requires that SFTs are reported to registered trade repositories, and obliges UCITS and AIFMs to report on their SFT activity.
Counterparties will also have to disclose the risks of particular SFTs and acquire consent to rehypothecate certain types of collateral.
Requirements on firms • Reporting: Counterparties to SFTs will have to report certain details of any SFT they have concluded, modified or terminated to a registered trade repository within one working day. • Record-keeping: Counterparties will also have to keep a record of SFTs for at least five years following the termination of the transaction. • Registration: Trade repositories accepting reported SFTs will need to register with the ESMA, in line with similar obligations under EMIR. • Transparency: UCITS management/investment companies and AIFMs will have to inform investors of their use of SFTs and total return swaps in yearly or half-yearly reports depending on the category of firm. • Disclosure: UCITS management/investment companies and AIFMs must provide investors with information on (a) what SFTs they are authorised to use and (b) how they employ said transactions. • Restrictions on re-use: counterparties will only be able to reuse instruments received as collateral if the providing counterparty has been informed in writing of the risks and gives prior consent.

element.name: 24.02.02 MIFID II reporting service
element.documentation:
MiFID2 extends the pre- and post-trade transparency regimes from equities traded on a regulated market to cover equity-like instruments such as DRs, ETFs and certificates that are traded on regulated trading venues as well as to cover non-equities such as bonds, structured finance products, emission allowances and derivatives. MiFID2 introduces new regulatory requirements for venues with members or participants that employ algorithmic trading techniques. MIFID2 also introduces regulatory requirements for investment firms which provide clients with direct market access and/or sponsored access (together, direct electronic access or DEA) to trading venues.
Reporting types:
1) Record keeping. Records of orders trade and trade related communcation.
2) Algo/HFT. RMs and other trading venues which permit algorithmic trading will be required to establish systems to limit the ratio of unexecuted orders to transactions, identify trades generated by algorithmic trading (which will require flags for specific traders and algorithms) and have in place “throttle limits” and, in certain limited circumstances, “kill switches” to stop trading by particular members / algorithms.
3) Commodity Derivatives. Another new requirement under MiFID2 is the establishment of net position limits in commodity derivatives traded on trading venues and economically equivalent OTC contracts. Under trading venues’ new obligations in relation to position management controls, a trading venue may require a person to terminate or reduce a position, on a temporary or permanent basis (and to take unilateral action to ensure such termination or reduction in the event of non-compliance) or require a person to provide liquidity back into the market at an agreed price and volume on a temporary basis with the express intent of mitigating the effects of a large or dominant position. MiFID2 also requires trading venues which trade commodity derivatives, emission allowances or derivatives to make public a weekly report with the aggregate positions held by different persons when both the number of persons and their open positions exceed certain minimum thresholds.
4) KYC. DEA provider to have proper procedures to assess client suitability as well as to put in place a binding written agreement with each client regarding the essential rights and obligations arising from the provision of the service and that the DEA provider retains regulatory responsibility under MiFID2.

element.name: 24.02.24 CAT reporting service
element.documentation:
CAT (Consolidated Audit Trail) - SEC Rule 613 requires FINRA and the national securities exchanges to jointly submit a National Market System (NMS) plan detailing how they would develop, implement and maintain a consolidated audit trail that collects and accurately identifies every order, cancellation, modification and trade execution for all exchange-listed equities and options across all U.S. markets. FINRA is working with the exchanges to develop an NMS plan that meets the requirements of Rule 613.
CAT went live January 4, 2021 and replaces OATS (Order Audit Trail System) where OATS Rules will be deleted from the FINRA rulebook effective September 1, 2021.
The CAT Customer & Account Information System (CAIS) is a separate system for submission of customer and account data and is scheduled to go live in two phases.
Phase 1 – April 2021 – CAT reporter firm must report account and LTID (Large Trader ID ) data associated with an FDID (Firm Designated ID)
Phase 2 – July 2022 – CAT reporter firms must report full customer and account data.
Currently AACC in house CAT report is implemented based on previous OAT report and is not CAT compliant. There is no CAIS implementation in AACC either. AACC plans to use vendor solution to meet the hard deadline of CAIS (July, 2022) and address the functional gap of CAT.
N-Tier is currently the industry leader in IT service provider for US regulatory report. CAT service can be delivered by N-Tier with two options: SaaS or On Premise. Both options will be explored in this doc.

element.name: 24.02.04 Facta reporting service
element.documentation: The Foreign Account Tax Compliance Act is a 2010 United States federal law requiring all non-U.S. financial institutions to search their records for customers with indicia of 'U.S.-person' status, such as a U.S. place of birth, and to report the assets and identities of such persons to the U.S. Department of the Treasury. FATCA also requires such persons to self-report their non-U.S. financial assets annually to the Internal Revenue Service on form 8938, which is in addition to the older and further redundant requirement to self-report them annually to the Financial Crimes Enforcement Network on form 114. Like U.S. income tax law, FATCA applies to U.S. residents and also to U.S. citizens and green card holders residing in other countries.

element.name: 10.5 Commodity Repo Service
element.documentation:
The parties to an EFRP are required to prepare and/or maintain all documents in connection with both the futures and related cash or OTC components of the EFRP. Upon request, any participant in an EFP transaction must provide the Exchange with such material, information and documents, which evidence title to, or the contract(s) to buy or sell, the cash commodity (or the by-product or related product) involved in the transaction. Each EFRP requires a bona fide transfer of ownership of the cash commodity between the parties or a bona fide, legally binding contract between the parties consistent with relevant market conventions for the particular related product transaction. Similarly, any participant in an EFS/EFR transaction, when requested, must provide the material, information and/or documents that demonstrate that the EFS/EFR is legitimate including, but not limited to, the master swap agreement and any supplements to it. Swap documents should contain all of the terms of the transaction, such as quantity, fixed price, floating price, how the settlement price is determined and the identity of the counterparty. For an EOO transaction, participants must provide documentation demonstrating that the OTC component is a legitimate OTC option transaction conducted by a person eligible to transact OTC options. A swap that is traded on or subject to the rules of a designated contract market (“DCM”) or a swap execution facility (“SEF”) is ineligible to be the related position component of an EFS/EFR or EOO transaction executed pursuant to Rule 4.06. This exclusion does not apply to swaps that are bilaterally negotiated and submitted for clearing-only to a Derivatives Clearing Organization (“DCO”) provided that such swaps have a reasonable price correlation with the exchange contract.
The documentation should demonstrate that the buyer (seller) of the cash commodity or OTC component was the seller (buyer) of the futures or options contract. The cash commodity or OTC component should involve the product underlying the exchange contract or a by-product or a related product that has a reasonable price correlation with the exchange contract. The quantity of the exchange contract(s) must be approximately equivalent to the quantity of the cash commodity or OTC component. The parties to an EFRP and/or each party’s Clearing Member, must also maintain, and provide upon Exchange request, all documents relevant to the futures or options component of the EFRP including account statements and order tickets (or other electronically time-stamped records).
The Exchange may also require the participants to produce additional documents related to the negotiation of the terms of the EFRP, such as emails, instant messages, or recorded audio communications, if they exist.

element.name: 27.1 Nostro management service
element.documentation:
A nostro account refers to an account that a bank holds in a foreign currency in another bank. Nostros, a term derived from the Latin word for "ours," are frequently used to facilitate foreign exchange and trade transactions. The opposite term "vostro accounts," derived from the Latin word for "yours," is how a bank refers to the accounts that other banks have on its books in its home currency. Most large commercial banks worldwide hold nostro accounts in every country with a convertible currency. Major examples of convertible currencies are the U.S. dollar, Canadian dollar, British pound, the euro and the Japanese yen.
Nostro management is the process of optimizing the cash balances held at various place in order to be able to support all transactions and to get the best interest result.

element.name: 27.4 Collateral management service
element.documentation: The management of all actions related to collateral provided by a borrower. Collateral management involves monitoring the asset for changes such as events and transfers. Changes to the collateral can be identified quickly under this type of management and may affect the terms of the loan agreement.

element.name: 27.3 Funding services
element.documentation: Funding is the act of providing financial resources, usually in the form of money, or other values such as effort or time, to finance a need, program, and project, usually by an organization or company. Generally, this word is used when a firm uses its internal reserves to satisfy its necessity for cash, while the term financing is used when the firm acquires capital from external sources.

ION is not capable to deliver all margin figures we need. IRS can"t (presently?) be handled. IRS margin figures are taken from CCP.

This service provides take up and give up services regarding cleared derivatives. This service provides clients the opportunity to act as a broker towards other clients and pass on the traded position towards the beneficial and it's GCM or to recieve a cleared transaction or position which was traded via another member (in the last case it is called a take up).
# Warshau exchange give up done via GTC Ffm, Seals not capable?
Brazil specifics: ALLOCATION, GIVE-UP AND DESIGNATION OF ACCOUNT AT THE LOCAL CUSTODIAN The allocation process is crucial for transaction settlement since it is when the Local Broker provides relevant information about the parties and accounts involved in the settlement. In the allocation process, the transactions’ settlement, position and risk management can be transfer red and specific deposit accounts can be indicated for delivery purposes. The Nonresident Investor (NRI) usually trades through a variety of Local Brokers but, in order to reduce operational complexity, risks and costs, it might choose to concentrate its holdings and positions in a single Local Custodian. As mentioned before, transactions can be settled at the B3 Clearinghouse by the Local Broker’s clearing member or they can be transferred for clearance and settlement by another broker/ clearing member. The same applies to the related position and risk management (give-up clearing). The give-up is instructed in the allocation process by the execution broker (Local Broker) and is subject to approval by the appointed carrying/settlement broker/clearing member. The give-up can be total or partial. As previously stated, trades must be allocated to a specific deposit account at the CSD. It is from/ to that account that the securities will be debited or credited for settlement purposes. The NRI also has the possibility of indicating its account with its Local Custodian for delivery purposes. Its cash settlement, position and risk management remain under the responsibility of the Local Broker’s Clearing Member. In this case, there is no give-up but, during the allocation process, the Local Broker will indicate the NRI’s account with the Local Custodian for delivery.

element.name: 04.7.3 IRS Zero coupon swap clearing service
04.7.1 IRS Plain vanilla OTC swap clearing
04.2 Synthetics service
element.documentation: The synthetic service provides client with the ability to take over the economic ownership of a position in single or basket of fianancial instruments without having the legal ownership and the need to settle the complete price of this underlying. The clients request the clearing bank to buy or sell a fianancial instrument (or basket). The moment the order is executed the clearing bank will issue a synthetic to the client transfering the complete economic risk towards the client. Next to the economic risk also agreements are made regarding the overall financing and other costs (like B&L) and over how to deal the corpoarate events.

element.name: 21.0 Customer collateral services
element.documentation: This service offers clients the option to activily manage the collateral they held via us with CCP's . It provides overview from the deposited and required obligations whereas upon the client, in cooperation with our client collateral officer, can act.

element.name: 22.0 (Corporate) events services
element.documentation: This service 1 guards the assets held for lifecycle events caused by changes to the assets made by the issuing company 2 distributes and coordinats entitlement distribution

element.name: 22.1 Entitlement service
element.documentation: These are mandatory events. This service distributed entitlements received direct or indirect from the issuing company to the righfull owner. The entitlement can be a direct- or a indirect/manufactored entitlement. The latter occur if an economic position exist without that the owner of this position is the legal owner. If cum/ex transactions are within our books over an entitlement distribution the clearing bank will actively claim the benefits in name of our clients. If a client solf over an entitlement the clearing bank will only pass on the entitled after being claimed or as this is required by the rules or regulations. All distributions comply the applicable law and take care of any witholding taxes and or publication/reporting requirements.

element.name: 22.1.1 Entitlement claim service
element.documentation: The objective of a market claim is to ensure that the proceeds of a corporate action distribution event (e.g. a cash dividend or a spin-off) reach the entitled party of a settlement transaction which failed to settle on the intended settlement date.

element.name: 22.5 Synthetics corparte events services
element.documentation: The synthetics corporate event services manages the manufactured entitlement distribution for synthetic contracts and it's adjustment as a result of lifecycle events caused by the instruments on which the synthetic contracts are based.

element.name: 22.2 Financial Instrument lifecycle management service
element.documentation: This service will follow up on changes to the fianancial instrument during it's lifecycle. It is a mandatory service. Events you can think off are for instance, name changes, (revers) split, change of nominal value, defalts, maturing bonds, drawing bond etc.

element.name: 22.3 Voluntary events service
element.documentation: This service deals with the voluntary corpoarate events. With these events the issuing company or a group of people (class actions) is launching an action to which an owner of a financial instrument can apply. Thing for instance off a class action, rights issue, take over, etc.

element.name: 22.4 SB&L & REPO contracts corporate event service
element.documentation: The SB&L corporate event services manages the manufactured entitlement distribution for SB&L contract and it's adjustment as a result of lifecycle events caused by the instruments on which the SB&L contracts are based.

element.name: 22.7 Issuing company financial instrument position reporting services
element.documentation: Issuing companies or governments can request certain information based on the legal jurisdictions. This service will provide that information. Information you can think about is for instance position information regarding the passing of a thresholds possed by a legal entity, the quantity of of shares owned etc.

element.name: 14.0 Data, Messages & report service
element.documentation: This service handles all in and outgoing data, messages and the creation of reports. The service is about the conceptual business content and its various occurences due to different data models and languages. The transformation needed to come from and to the conceptual level from Physical and Logical models are part of the service.

element.name: 14.5.1 Drop copy services
element.documentation:
This service forward external received messages to clients for the clearbank has formally accepted the message. This can be done:
1) raw, the messages is sent as received in external forward
2) converted to our internal format, in this case the stream is split directly after our enrichment and for our downstream processing starts.

element.name: 14.9 Data Mapping & enrichment service
element.documentation: The service contains data modelling, meta-data management, transformation, and messaging integration

element.name: 14.7 Data mining, data science and querying service
element.documentation: This service enables the harvesting and publication of data throughout our landscape for ad-hoc request and research.

element.name: 05.0 Primairy Products Settlement service
element.documentation: This service settles the transfer of ownership of a primary product as a result of a trade of transaction or it moves a primary product from on account (internal or external) to another of the same client. The settlement service allows clients to do OTC business, to move securities between depots, to exchange one security for another, to settle corporate actions or to process ex/as.

An order contains invalid data (eg a missing value)
Risk, Treasury, or SBL reject the order due to a breached amount, or lack of availability of stock
Operations manually reject the order for any other business reason (eg the Issuer rejects the application)

element.documentation: In some cases a Client may also send a request for their order to be CANCELLED. If the order is not yet Actioned or Confirmed, it will automatically cancel, otherwise it will become CANCEL REQUESTED, and Operations will need to confirm the Cancellation also, as it usually requires agreement with the Issuer by this point - it is possible to Reject a Cancellation in the event the Issuer doesn't agree to cancel the application.

Contract For Difference
A contract for difference is a contract between two parties, typically described as "buyer" and "seller", stipulating that the buyer will pay to the seller the difference between the current value of an asset and its value at contract time

element.name: 24 DRA report 14
element.documentation:
De basis wordt gevormd door de huidige Dra-rapportage voor beleggingsinstellingen ten
behoeve van de betalingsbalans. Dat betekent onder meer dat effecten op security-by-security
basis door middel van zogenoemde ISIN-codes gerapporteerd kunnen worden. Ook
impliceert dit dat het zogeheten reconciliatiemodel zal worden gevolgd. Dat wil zeggen dat
een verloop-/mutatie-overzicht wordt gevraagd van beginstand, via transacties (aan- en
verkopen), herwaarderingen (wisselkoersveranderingen en prijsmutaties) en overige mutaties,
naar eindstand. Nieuw is dan dat DNB deze gegevens niet alleen voor de buitenlandse
posities, maar ook voor de binnenlandse posities zal vragen. Creator: 24 Consumer: 14

element.name: 17 CRQ request 14
element.documentation:
CRQ : Client Risk Questionaire. Puspose questionaire is to assess our clients risk and control framework.
The questionaire will help controlling our reputational and credit risks.
The questionaire will be update on a regular base.
The questionaire exisit in two difficulties; a light version for clients only trading via voice brokerage and the normal version for clients dealing direct. Reasong for the light version is that these clients, as trading via a voice broker set up, are not hit by "fat vingers"or algo's getting out of control.

Chief Technology Officer (CTO)
element.documentation:
Paul van Vlaanderen
Chief Technology Officer (CTO)
The Chief Technology Officer is responsible for the day-to-day running of the clearing IT services, as well as defining and executing the IT Infrastructure & Operations strategy for AACB around the world
The current Global CTO role is responsible for the Global Technology Services (GTS) organisation
which will be renamed to ‘Global Platform Grid’ and organised into a Global Grid Structure with 10
5
4
Request for advice concerning Global Agile Transformation p14
Platform blocks including Public Cloud Platforms, Private Infra Platforms, Networking Services,
Security & Observability, D&A Platform and Digital Workplace.
The existing GTS organisation provides the product and development teams with tailored
environments to the specific needs of the developers with the Global Product Grid, this creates both
complexity and inefficiencies in AACBs IT operating model. The new CTO role will have increased
responsibility to ensure AACB moves to standardised environment stacks with an increased focus
on the use of new technologies (Public Cloud, Private Cloud containers and CICD pipelines).
The to-be Global CTO role has full end-to-end responsibility for IT Infrastructure Platforms & Products
including Change, Run and Control activities (regulatory, operations, monitoring, budget & IT risk)
and automating those where possible. This also includes the management of the Product Owners
who have the responsibility for the individual products within the Platform Grid.
When comparing the as-is CTO role, the new role carries increased responsibilities moving from
vision & execution to a full end-to-end responsibility, which includes vision, strategy, day-to-day
running, control, risk, regulations and budget.
The conclusion from these changes in responsibilities, is that the role is changed. Please consult
chapter 4 for personnel consequences.

element.name: AACB Function
element.documentation: The AACB function explains the role and mandate a staff member has within the AACB organisation.

element.name: Lead Product Owner (LPO)
element.documentation:
Lead Product Owner (LPO)
The Lead Product Owner has the same responsibilities as a Product Owner for the block, with some additional tasks incl. alignment of the objectives within the cluster and supporting the POs

element.name: GTS PO
element.documentation:
Product Owner (PO)
The Product Owner has a clear mandate to define priorities within the block’s scope, closely aligning with the capability strategy and validating those in the QBR memo that is written in collaboration with the key business stakeholders and approved by the GMT

element.name: Chapter lead
element.documentation:
Chapter Lead
A Chapter lead is a block member that has an additional responsibility for the “how” of his/her chapter in terms of people management and capability building. He/she is experienced in the field of work and can directly coach peers on the subject matter

element.name: Chief Information Officer (CIO)
element.documentation:
Chief Information Officer (CIO)
The Chief Information Officer defines the global information technology vision and roadmap to support the company’s business objectives steering the CoEs and platform grid

element.name: Data Vendor
element.documentation: Provides pre and post-trade transparency as well as a reliable price formation

element.documentation: Chief Commercial Officer
